industries: Software Development
description:
Descartes Unites the People and Technology that Move the World





The need for efficient, secure, and agile supply chains and logistics operations has become ever more critical and complex. By combining innovative technology, powerful trade intelligence and the reach of our network, Descartes helps get goods, information, transportation assets, and people where they're needed, when they're needed. 




We're one of the most broadly deployed logistics and supply chain technology companies in the world. More than 22,000 customers around the globe use our cloud-based solutions to transform the way they move inventory and information to enhance productivity, better serve customers, thrive competitively, keep pace with evolving regulations, and respond to rapidly changing market conditions.




Descartes is publicly traded (Nasdaq:DSGX, TSX:DSG) with headquarters in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, and offices and partners around the world. With record financial performance for more than 16 years, we lead the industry in innovation investment. Every day, logistics service providers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, and other logistics-intensive businesses of all sizes rely on our scale, stability, and comprehensive solution footprint to move what's most important to them. 




We're growing fast and invite you to join our amazing team. 





The opportunity





Reporting to the SVP IT Services, we are seeking a VP, IT Operations to own and lead the execution of our IT roadmap. You will oversee the 24/7 network operations centre, various Infrastructure teams and drive strategic projects. From supporting our North American Data Centres, ensuring teams operate collaboratively with a global lens, and overseeing the timely response to technical issues and critical incidents, this is an opportunity to make a measurable business impact on our IT operations and, ultimately, customer satisfaction. You will play a critical role in our transformation from traditional data centre infrastructure to a highly automated DevOps framework.





What's in it for you







Exposure and influence. 

You are an IT Services Director looking for an opportunity to move into a VP role where you can introduce efficiency, apply insights, and implement scalability and best practices in the journey towards DevOps. You want to join an established, growing company solving global supply chain problems with cutting-edge solutions. You want to expand your accountability and ownership to lead an exciting organizational transformation and make a tangible difference, building a path to modernization with measurable outcomes. 






Professional advancement and autonomy. 

At Descartes, we value the contributions that each of our employees makes towards achieving our corporate goals. We strive to ensure that each team member has the tools and support they need to make valuable contributions. You will be an active contributor amongst globally recognized industry leaders, including the SVP, who is committed to mentorship, guidance, and giving you the independence to lead your work and accomplish your goals. 





What you will do:








Be the voice of innovation and stability. 

You will be forward-thinking and strategic from day one. You will apply your in-depth knowledge and skills to provide technical and team-level oversight, prioritizing availability and resilience - and evolving to automation and DevOps. You will manage resources and technological objectives to deliver on business and financial goals. You will ensure all IT initiatives are completed as proposed and quality is achieved. Your project work may include:

Optimizing security within the data centres. You will partner with Security to implement a proactive and reactive response existing and emerging threats. 

Consolidating management of new data centres. You will establish a core set of processes to standardize the management of technology acquired through the onboarding of new companies every year.

Building a stronger identity access management framework.

Managing and mitigating risk for any legacy technology stacks and products.

Establishing an evaluation framework to prioritize IT projects, balancing urgency, speed, and costs. 



Advise senior leaders.

 You will be the first point of contact, operate at a group and enterprise-wide level, and serve as a specialist with insights and analytics to inform and guide decision-makers and stakeholders. 



Continuous improvement.

 You will assess our current state, processes, and tools, to recommend automations, improvements, updates, and re-align our traditional data centres with an automated cloud infrastructure. You will research technology trends, tools, and best practices.



Manage the team. 

You will foster a culture of collaboration within and across groups and ensure engagement and satisfaction within your team.






What you bring:








The education and experience. 

You have a degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or the equivalent work experience. You have 10 years of progressive experience in technology, including 5+ years leading a 24/7 IT Operations team responding to urgent changes and downtime incidents. You have expertise in the development and/or deployment of tools, trends, and methodologies, combined with your broader understanding of IT services and cloud infrastructure fundamentals. You have been part of a transition, in some capacity, to the cloud and highly automated DevOps. 



The project management.

 You have experience planning and delivering complex implementation projects, from the proposal and budget to resources and timing of deliverables. 



The people leadership.

 You can direct the work of a large, diverse team, remove roadblocks, manage conflict, and identify gaps in skills and resources to effectively manage the team's work. You practice active listening and empathetic engagement across diverse perspectives. You are a champion of your team and your own ideas, able to adopt the best idea but defend your own choices.



The drive. 

You are tenacious and have finely tuned troubleshooting abilities, diving into problems, analyzing situations, and innovating solutions. You continuously pursue new technologies and can quickly learn new tools. 



The interpersonal skills.

 You have flexible and effective communication skills. You can build strong internal and external relationships and engage stakeholders at all levels. 






Making an Impact





We succeed when our customers succeed so, for us, results are everything. Descartes' logistics and supply chain solutions help automate, streamline and secure the flow of goods and information in ways that result in a significant positive impact on the environment. In 2020, we helped our customers save over 552 thousand metric tons of CO2, 1.86 billion sheets of paper, and 727 million liters of fuel. 




Descartes has a deep sense of environmental responsibility. Join a team that's committed to working with customers to conserve resources and enhance sustainability. 





Join Us


As we scale, we're looking for new doers, collaborators and innovators to join Descartes in uniting the people and technology that move the world as the Global Leader in Logistics and Supply Chain Technology. 




We're entrepreneurial, hardworking, geeky-in-a-good way problem solvers. Guided by our values, we nurture a TEAM focused culture that invests in people and creates opportunities for advancement across a broad spectrum of career paths. We prioritize work-life balance and foster an environment with the space to take ownership, to be heard, and to carve a path for your individual accomplishments to help drive our success. At Descartes, everyone has a voice and the best argument wins, regardless of who makes it. 




We offer competitive compensation, great benefits, remote and flexible work hours, and the opportunity to join a company on an awesome mission with a great existing team and trajectory.

If you feel you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, and Descartes sounds like the team and the mission you want to be part of, apply now. We can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience.




Due to COVID-19, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video (Microsoft TEAMS) and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.




We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity, please review our EEO is the Law , Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Statement, EEO/AA Statement . Descartes participates in the E-Verify program. Please click below to learn more about the E-Verify program. Notice of E-Verify Participation Right to Work (English and Spanish).




Descartes is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. Applicants in North America with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can email us at hrna@descartes.com. Provide your name and contact information along with the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process. Your request will be responded to as soon as possible. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Moving software to the cloud has been revolutionary for businesses, especially around costs. But if you're a software architect with a strategic or financial bent, you know so many companies are merely scratching the surface. If that's you - we want to hear from you!

Trilogy seeks system-level thinkers to dive deep into software architecture and identify repeatable cost-saving opportunities with material business impact. You will be designing solutions that systematically cut millions of dollars of cloud costs for Fortune 500 companies.

Anybody can stuff their on-premises setup in some containers, push it to the cloud, and save money. And there are plenty of teams who can do some bill hacking, focusing solely on the billing and cloud watch metrics. But we want someone truly technical to go deeper and look for fundamental ways to re-architect software to use AWS in a meaningful way. Cost matters, but the quality of our products comes first. And as AWS rolls out new products, we want someone excited to learn these new products and put them to use to cut costs further.

This role will provide daily learning opportunities because of the footprint and scope of our cloud implementations. You will have a laboratory to experiment with your ideas. You will find opportunities to test and validate them within our vast portfolio. And you get to stay on the cutting edge, assessing, experimenting with, and deploying the latest and greatest AWS offerings.

If you want to impact our cloud economics and are ready to expand your professional development beyond code into strategic and financial decision-making, this is the role for you!



What You Will Be Doing



Each week you will have a different cost optimization problem to work on and technical specs to create. You will be:


Identifying patterns in complex systems and finding ways to make them 10x simpler

Making important decisions that specify how to systematically optimize cloud resource consumption, simplify architecture, and improve the quality of the product simultaneously

Distilling those decisions into precise and well-documented written technical specifications that a team of engineers can implement

Learning and working on a wide variety of products with distinct tech stacks and business domains




What You Won’t Be Doing




Ignoring technical implementation and focusing solely on financial metrics

Managing vendors or negotiating contracts

Providing day-to-day direction to an engineering team




Director Of Information Technology Key Responsibilities




Make clear, simple, technically superior design decisions that optimize cost

Deliver data-driven decisions that are rooted in technical depth

Produce detailed written specifications that put your insights into action




Basic Requirements




4+ years of experience making important architecture and design decisions on software projects, such as the application of architecture design patterns or significant open source technologies

Experience making important cloud cost decisions at a company with an annual cloud spend of at least USD 100,000

2+ years of experience shipping production-quality code

2+ years of experience as the decision-maker for the use of cloud-based services such as Amazon Web Services, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform

Great analytical skills and sound financial acumen




About Trilogy



Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Director Strategic Communication & Digital Engineering

Career Level

The Director, Strategic Communications & Digital Engagement is responsible for the creation and successful execution of the Faculty of Health Sciences communications strategy, including social media and website development. The Director will develop and execute an evidence-based communications strategy that:


Strengthens the Faculty of Health Sciences’ local and international profile and activities in key markets

Addresses the areas of opportunity identified in the communications needs assessment and strategic plan

Leverages synergies across the Faculty of Health Sciences and the University to achieve a cohesive, effective and sustainable approach to communications

Develops and leads integrated and comprehensive reputation marketing and reputational development strategies






Strategic Leadership



The Director will develop and execute an evidence-based communications strategy that creates and directs short and long-term strategic planning for communications within the Faculty of Health Sciences

As a senior advisor to the Dean & VP, FHS and senior management team, this position must be proactive in understanding and helping to prioritize the faculty's marketing objectives and be a role model in collaboration, diplomacy, and working in cross functional teams.

The position must be proactive to increase marketing capacity within FHS and to provide comprehensive institutional leadership in its areas of responsibility. The role will develop external relationships on behalf of the University in a wide range of sectors and with a variety of external agencies.

Creates and directs a digital, social media and website strategy that builds the Faculty’s profile and reputation

Lead the development of strategy documents, marketing tools and other materials required to support the marketing plan

Analyze, evaluate, and assess risk and impact of developments internal and external to the Faculty and University

Anticipate changes in the sector and provide timely information and strategy on emerging issues, opportunities and changing trends to ensure the Faculty and McMaster is well positioned

Develops and implements structural changes within the Faculty related to communications, as needed, that will ensure resources are being utilized where they can best advance the Faculty’s strategic goals

Develops strategy for alignment and synergies of varied departmental communication across the Faculty

Identifies ongoing enhancements and continuous improvement to the Faculty’s communications programs for faculty, staff and students

Develops and implements strategy for current and new social media platforms for the FHS, as appropriate and aligned to the university’s strategy. In particular, develops and manages social media profile for the FHS Dean and Vice-President.

Develops, implements and oversees content portion of website development and management strategy for FHS, co-leading the FHS web steering committee with the FHS IT director, and ensuring FHS websites are professional, branded, effective and grow the Faculty’s profile and reputation

Leads a coordinated, pro-active and strategic media relations and marketing plan with measurable results and positive impact on Faculty objectives

Provides counsel and support to senior University leadership on emerging issues and opportunities, including utilizing a pro-active approach as much as possible

Establishes productive relationships with key University and Faculty stakeholders

Responsible for the graphic design and production of marketing materials within the FHS portfolio

Leads operational and process improvements within the department, an environment characterized by high volume requests, time-sensitive events and sensitivity to appropriate and effective messaging

Supports ongoing pro-active communication, specifically highlighting Faculty and clinical research initiatives

Participates in several committees including the FHS Academic Administrators, Faculty Executive and the FHS Operations Group. The Director acts as an advisor and subject matter expert in a variety of University steering committees and working groups.

Fosters and demonstrates the" best practice" approach in all activities and supports others within the department in developing this philosophy

Effectively partners with the Director, Public Relations in executing an aligned communications philosophy and approach for the Faculty of Health Sciences

Demonstrates and promotes excellence in digital engagement and communications






Reputation & Brand Development



Initiate and maintain ongoing communication with university leaders and key external audiences to advance the interests of FHS by highlighting the achievements, impact and aspirations of the Faculty

Ensure consistent and proactive communication on marketing issues and opportunities to maximize opportunities and identify risks to the Faculty and University’s brand

Provide leadership across the FHS to enhance the Faculty’s ability to support the achievement of its priorities and objectives through an enhanced reputation and strong national and international marketing position

Act as primary lead for marketing activities and represent the Faculty at a variety of meetings with external groups

Ensure the Faculty and University have positive relationships with strategically placed influencers

Partners and effectively collaborates with the University’s Communications and Public Affairs (CAPA) department, acting as an advocate for the communication needs of the Faculty of Health Sciences, whilst leveraging synergie cross-campus and aligning on university messaging where appropriate

Leads Faculty marketing and branding initiatives and strengthens the Faculty’s collaborative approach to marketing within a decentralized environment, to support the growth of the profile of FHS

Partners and effectively collaborates with the Assistant Vice President, Communications and Public Affairs, participating in CAPA committees as a representative of FHS where appropriate






Planning and Reporting



Initiate and manage FHS's annual marketing planning and outreach defining measurable goals and objectives, and analyzing issues, results and opportunities

Ensure compliance with procurement provisions

Create and oversee key performance indicators and metrics to measure outcomes

Prepare weekly reports on activities and future opportunities and develop and maintain advance system of marketing contacts and information






Experience/Skills



A minimum seven years’ experience in a senior communications strategic role within a complex organization, preferably in a university or public sector environment

Demonstrated ability to thrive in an unpredictable, time-sensitive and high-pressure environment.

Proven experience in providing valued strategic advice and counsel on diverse, complex and sensitive matters to an organizations most senior leaders.

Demonstrated ability to effectively lead a marketing team to successfully contribute to furthering the mission of the organization

Requires flexibility and a broad knowledge of areas from labour relations and finance, to marketing, municipal planning, and design and production.

Demonstrated ability to plan and organize strategic and complex programs and projects

Ability to build internal and external relationships, drawing on excellent interpersonal, research and analytical, oral and written skillsSuperb leadership and organizational skills, as exemplified by the ability to engender confidence, to work with a variety of stakeholders in a collegial fashion, to build consensus, to advance key priorities and to deliver results

Exceptional analytical, problem-solving facilitation and conflict resolution skills within a culturally diverse multi-location work environment

Knowledge of the governance, systems and decision-making processes and governing bodies at the University

Ability to build internal capacity, while building strong and sustainable relations with the external community including partner healthcare organizations and union leadership

Strong leadership and team building skills

Managerial experience in a unionized environment an asset

Superior written and verbal communication skills

Proven ability to work highly effectively in a multi-tasked environment under high pressure with high volume of work

Ability to work with minimal direction

Tact and discretion, especially under pressure

Awareness of the changing media landscape

Marketing and brand implementation experience

Knowledge and fluences in the use of emerging media and the CMS and other systems required to facilitate advancements in these areas

Ability to implement best practices across a wide range of areas within the function

Sound judgment and decision making

Direct experience in crisis and issues management

Proven experience with change management

Experience in budget management

Demonstrated creativity

Excellent, demonstrated interpersonal skills

Experience with evidence-based program measurement and evaluation

 Build a prototype, in conjunction with the project leads, demonstrating core game concepts

description:
THE TEAM


The mission of the Retail Operations Department is to be the architects and curators of the retail business.





THE OPPORTUNITY


Aritzia is growing, and our Retail Operations team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to lead the team responsible for the back-end prioritization and architecture of the Retail business. As the Sr. Director, Strategic Alignment, you will play a pivotal role in planning and driving the strategic priorities for Retail, establishing the architecture of the division’s infrastructure and programming, identifying opportunities to capitalize on growth and protecting the business from undue risk. And, with people at the heart of everything you do, you will support your high-potential people to grow rewarding careers at Aritzia—while enjoying one yourself. 





THE ROLE


As the Sr. Director, Strategic Alignment, you will lead the team to:





Facilitate the identification, evaluation, prioritization, and resourcing of work across the Retail division

Establish the structure for retail people, process, technology, reporting and space infrastructure, ensuring it is fit for purpose and scalability

Develop and manage the business's key performance indicators to forecast and analyze company performance in partnership with Finance and Data Analytics Teams

Ensure that the right system and programs are in place for the Retail business

Identify and capitalize on sales maximizing or cost minimizing opportunities. Mitigate risks and impacts associated with extraordinary events, ensuring minimal disruption to the business.

Work with the appropriate Business Support partners to seamlessly lead the day-to-day function of the department in support of corporate objectives, while enabling progressive career development and an incredible employee experience






THE QUALIFICATIONS


The Sr. Director, Strategic Alignment has:





Proven and best-in-class skills, education, and/or applicable certifications, including:






Significant experience in a Retail Strategic Planning role

Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written communication) 

Strong Analytical Skills - Critical thinking, data information and analysis, research, communication and problem-solving






A commitment to learn, apply, champion, and enrich Aritzia's Values, Business and People Leadership principles

The skills to collaborate strategically with cross-functional partners in the pursuit of shared business outcomes

The ability to set clear objectives and design a strategy that inspires the team

A dedication to quality and investing in results and new business opportunities that add value at all times






THE PERKS 


Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:





A-OK Commissary & Café - Our in-office, world-class bistro and café

Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work









ARITZIA



Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

If you are a hands-on technical leader looking to create a bigger impact, then we think it’s about time to get yourself out of the middle management trap. You’ve been a software engineer your whole career and proven yourself an effective technical leader. Shouldn’t an elite engineer like you be the one making important decisions for your company?

At Trilogy, management doesn’t simply mean oversight. It means making important technical decisions.

Trilogy is an enterprise software company, run by actual software engineers, not MBAs. We are looking for high-performing architects with hands-on technical leadership experience to spearhead the most important teams in our engineering department. We need technical experts to solve our most challenging software engineering problems.

If you’re looking to take charge in a high-stakes environment, we’d like to challenge you to lead a fast-scaling organization responsible for dozens of high-quality software releases per week.



What You Will Be Doing




Software architecture design. Making important technical decisions based on product change requests. 

Deep Dive analysis. Analyze technical problems and opportunities to improve our software quality, getting all the way into the code.

Writing Improvement Proposals. You will make technical recommendations to improve the quality of our software development, based on your deep dive findings.




What You Won’t Be Doing




HR and administrative management. We want your technical expertise. We will never waste your time doing performance reviews, committees, etc. 

Overseeing steady-state operations. Our culture is continuous improvement. If it’s bad, fix it. If it’s good, make it better.




Director Of Engineering Key Responsibilities



Improving our software development operation. Based on your insights from reviewing a week’s worth of work, you propose and implement big ideas to simplify the code, systematically improve quality, and scale our growing portfolio of over 100 B2B software products.



Basic Requirements




Technical/quantitative university degree. 

5+ years of experience writing code. You’ll have to pass a coding test to get this job.

Experience managing teams from multiple engineering functions (developers, designers, product managers, testers, etc.)




Nice-to-have Requirements




Experience using deep work blocks to maximize quality and output

Experience working 100% remotely with asynchronous communication dominating how you collaborate

Cloud development experience, especially AWS




About Trilogy



Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

description:
The Layout Finaling Supervisor plays an integral role in the production team. They supervise all aspects of Layout Finaling from casting shots to approval of artists’ work, making sure each shot is correct technically and artistically and ready for consumption by all downstream departments. They work closely with each department to ensure that all shots have the correct elements and cameras. This is a regular, full time, staff position that will be located at our Vancouver, BC studio. Please note that relocation eligibility may be determined based on role and individual circumstance.


Responsibilities : 



Role Specifics


Works closely with the Director Of Cinematography - Layout, Director of Cinematography - Lighting, Production Designer, and Director to make sure each shot is correct technically and artistically and ready for consumption by all downstream departments.

Works closely with the supervisors of each department to ensure that each shot is populated with the correct elements and cameras and presented in a rendered form at Sweatbox.

Guides and manages the Layout Finaling Artists and works with the Camera Polisher in the following tasks:


Final Camera


Cameras parameters are correct for each shot

Camera movement (including camera shake) and composition are trued up post-Animation


Final Shot File


All elements of each shot file are present, correct, and consumable by downstream departments

Any additional set dressing called out for post-Layout

Continuity of all elements for each shot is correct


Sweatbox


Creating a render of each shot for evaluation in Sweatbox

Helping to troubleshoot render issues so shots can make their way to Sweatbox




Implementation




Responsible for consumability and efficiency of artist deliverables into downstream departments. 

Participates in department processes, bidding, and reviews.

Assesses resource needs and collaborates with department leadership in helping find staffing solutions. 


Leading People




Creates an inclusive and safe work environment by carefully managing sensitive information, making rooms feel open and comfortable, creating space for everyone to have a voice, and addressing bias when it occurs. 

Guides the creative and technical vision/expectations for the team members. 

In tight conjunction with the Director of Cinematography - Layout, Production Management, and Department Manager, inspires and motivates the team. 

Contributes to the overall craft and development of team members through setting expectations, delivering consistent constructive feedback, recognition, and accountability. 


Collaboration




Models and fosters a collaborative work environment between individuals on the team and across departments. 

Identifies solutions and compromises in partnership with other supervisors.


Communication




Provides regular updates to direct leaders on the progress, health, and direction of the team. 

Keeps the team informed with context for the show related changes and updates. 


Studio Stewardship




Studio Culture- Actively fosters an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative environment so every employee can contribute at the highest levels. 

Technology, Tools, and Workflow- Engages in the creation and execution of technical standards, pipeline conventions, and workflows to support the department, show, and studio.

Department Stewardship- Partners closely with peers and Department Manager to support an environment of creativity, trust, and innovation. Actively involved in assessment, casting, hiring, and overall growth of artists. 




Additional Information : 


Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

description:
GlobeStar Systems 
is a leader in integrated clinical communication. Our cornerstone product, Connexall®, is an award-winning Enterprise grade IoT platform, purpose built for the healthcare industry. Connexall® is a sophisticated and customizable end-to-end integration and communication platform that helps its customers improve clinical workflow, reduce alarm fatigue, and drive better patient and staff outcomes.





Leadership and Culture





GlobeStar Systems is deeply committed to the recruitment and retention of values-based, transformative leaders who have demonstrated experience in establishing and nurturing a safe, respectful, and inclusive culture. It is our expectation that our leaders will be corporately focused at all times, while also providing leadership in driving out their mandates and coaching and developing their staff. A leadership consciousness is paramount.





Director of Human Resources





Reporting to the Executive Vice-President, the Director of Human Resources will be responsible for planning, developing, and implementing HR strategies and initiatives that align with the overall business strategy and increase employee satisfaction. The successful candidate will bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues. Additionally, they will work closely with the Company’s executives to understand the organization’s culture and manage activities such as job design, recruitment and retention, employee relations, performance management, organizational structure, HR planning and strategy, compensation, training and organizational development, health and safety, and talent management.





Primary Responsibilities






Review recruitment plan, establish strategic timeline for resources, provide oversight for the approval/denial of requested resources.

Manage an effective hiring process including but not limited to reviewing applicants before hire, approving contracts/salaries, participating in interviews for high level positions, approving background check, and providing oversight of the review of new hire paperwork.

Develop employee retention strategies and measure ongoing effectiveness

Manage and create a corporate onboarding plan for all positions within the organization. This includes supporting Connexall solution training in an effective and expedited manner.

Develop total compensation benchmarking model.

Ensure the successful implementation of a training program for current employees to develop business and technical skills.

Review and recommend training programs and materials to assist employees in achieving their talent development goals.

Create a talent succession plan for the Company outlining the steps within the organization, competencies required, trainings required, and review and approve any applications for internal movement.

Evaluate, formulate, and approve new HR policies, procedures, guidelines, and structures and own the Corporate Policy Manual.

Devise, approve, and measure effectiveness of strategies to motivate employees and enhance the organization’s culture.

Develop an ongoing leadership coaching model to enhance the management teams competencies.

Review employee grievances and investigations, determining resolutions and escalating or conducting further investigations if necessary.

Advise managers and participate in employee discipline.

Develop learning management plan framework.

Oversee offboarding processes; advise managers and take part in terminations, analyze turnover, and develop plans to improve employee retention.

Review exit interview information and formulate and implement organizational changes to improve retention.

Develop and implement a performance management and performance evaluation process by creating a standardized process for approving salary increases, discretionary bonuses, and role changes.

Manage and control all employee files ensuring they are up to date, confidential, and approve requests to see them.

Manage organizational chart, job titles, job descriptions, vacation schedules, and salary bands.

Analyze HR metrics, prepare reports and strategic initiatives based on data, measure improvement and achievement based on goals.

Other duties as required.






Qualifications






A Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field required.

Master’s degree, PhD, or MBA in relevant field preferred.

CHRL or CHRE considered an asset.

10+ years of relevant experience required.

5+ years of leadership experience required.

Experience in a technical or software company preferred.

Healthcare experience or knowledge considered an asset.

In-depth knowledge of labour law and HR best practices.

Exceptional leadership skills, with a proven track record of building, motivating, and managing geographically diverse, high-performing, teams.

Excellent communication skills; written, oral, and presentation skills.

Ability to understand the organizational structure, culture, and best practices to grow a company in the software industry.

Experience creating organizational charts, reports, and other documents.

Generalized knowledge of HR systems and databases; must provide oversight of and direction for web-based and other recruiting strategies, which may include online job posting boards.

Demonstratable experience with HR metrics; ability to effectively analyze numerical data, draw logical inferences and provide reasonable recommendations.

Strong attention to detail with the ability to accurately and thoroughly monitor work for quality and ensuring standard specifications are met.

Able to manage time effectively while overseeing a high volume of work by prioritizing and planning work activities.

Ability to multitask; must be able to manage a team, produce results, and meet deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Strong interpersonal and active listening skills with the ability to facilitate conflict resolution.

Ability to facilitate conflict resolution and to teach conflict resolution techniques to other departmental managers.

Creative and adaptable with strong execution abilities.

Ability to coordinate and work cross-functionally for the betterment of the Company.

Must be trustworthy with a strong sense of ethics due to nature of work and exposure to confidential information.

To drive retention and account growth, we work hard on delighting our customers and putting our resources into making them successful with our products. You will get to hone your performance management skills and constantly make your team better for our customers.

You'll set the standard for the team and keep raising it. Take your expertise and ability to make the team perform at your level. Have an impact as you drive performance at scale while staying close to the action.

Following an extensive and regular review of the sales team's real work, this role will spend most of their day leveraging their software sales expertise to drive team improvements:


Doing detailed win/loss analysis to coach and improve sales coaching.

Using product information and playbooks to develop and refine high-quality content (conversation plans, email templates, discovery questions, etc.)

Developing system-level insights and documenting data-driven important actions that drive programmatic improvements across the platform

Writing high impact proposals to improve how the selling is done


You may also spend some time maintaining a sharp edge by directly engaging in sales discussions with customers.



What You Won’t Be Doing



This role is not about the dark arts of sales forecasting, cold calling, closing, nickel, and diming customers, air miles, or relying on your gut. It is not about earning a commission.

You will not lead the customer conversation, and you will not be the one closing the deals.



Sales Director Key Responsibilities



Instead of having you chase a quota with potentially misaligned incentives, we are willing to give you certainty on comp because we know what we need you to do to drive results. We are obsessed with quality - we make the tools and the team great and let results follow from there. You will not be exposed/dependent on other parts of the organization dropping the ball. You are responsible for raising the performance of the whole sales team to that of the top performers through a relentless focus on quality.



Basic Requirements




At least 5 years experience in global B2B SaaS/software sales

Consciously adept at top-down selling

Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience

Ability to synthesize product information even when it gets a little technical




Nice-to-have Requirements




Coaching training

Telco or marketing solutions sales experience

Performance management training

Data analytics training




About Trilogy



Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

description:
The Lighting Supervisor plays an integral role in the production team. They will supervise all aspects of lighting assigned sequences. They will supervise a team of artists, and work with the Art Director and Director of Cinematography - Lighting to realize the Director's vision. This is a regular, full time, staff position that will be located at our Vancouver, BC studio. Please note that relocation eligibility may be determined based on role and individual circumstance.


Responsibilities : 



Role Specifics




Work with the Director of Cinematography - Lighting to realize their vision to define and implement the lighting style and practices for the show.

Collaborate with the Director of Cinematography - Lighting to bid the lighting of the film, and be responsible for the delivery of lit shots in a timely manner.

Maintain lighting continuity through all assigned sequences.

Participate with the Director of Cinematography – Lighting and the Production Supervisors in coordinating the production including identifying and casting lighting packets.

Drive and participate in the testing of new tools and processes.

Participate with the Asset Supervisor to create an initial material library and asset light rig.


Implementation




Responsible for consumability and efficiency of artist deliverables into downstream departments. 

Participates in department processes, bidding, and reviews.

Assesses resource needs and collaborates with department leadership in helping find staffing solutions. 


Leading People




Creates an inclusive and safe work environment by carefully managing sensitive information, making rooms feel open and comfortable, creating space for everyone to have a voice, and addressing bias when it occurs. 

Guides the creative and technical vision/expectations for the team members. 

In tight conjunction with the Director of Cinematography - Lighting, Production Management, and Department Manager, inspires and motivates the team. 

Contributes to the overall craft and development of team members through setting expectations, delivering consistent constructive feedback, recognition, and accountability. 


Collaboration




Models and fosters a collaborative work environment between individuals on the team and across departments. 

Identifies solutions and compromises in partnership with other supervisors.


Communication




Provides regular updates to the Director of Cinematography - Lighting on the progress, health, and direction of the team. 

Keeps the team informed with context for show related changes and updates. 


Studio Stewardship




Studio Culture- Actively fosters an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative environment so every employee can contribute at the highest levels. 

Technology, Tools, and Workflow- Engages in the creation and execution of technical standards, pipeline conventions, and workflows to support the department, show, and studio.

Department Stewardship- Partners closely with peers and Department Manager to support an environment of creativity, trust, and innovation. Actively involved in assessment, casting, hiring, and overall growth of artists. 




Basic Qualifications : 




Minimum 2 years of leadership experience that demonstrates a strong ability to lead and mentor others.

Experience as a Lighting Supervisor, Sequence Supervisor, CG Supervisor, or similar role in CG Animation.

Ability to quickly learn and adapt to WDAS standards, pipeline, tools and workflows as they relate to the discipline you would be leading. 

Strong understanding of the filmmaking process.

Strong understanding of the principles of lighting and material properties.

Strong knowledge and understanding of show pipelines and workflows.

Excellent problem solving skills.

Ability to present ideas and to communicate clearly with artistic and studio leadership.

Ability to work in a collaborative environment, taking as well as giving direction with tact.

Bachelor's degree or higher in Art, Illustration, Cinema Studies, Computer Graphics, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience.

Experience in doing foundation or key lighting.

Strong knowledge of each of the following technical areas:

Maya®, GI Rendering, Nuke® (or comparable compositing system)

3D texture painting and mapping tools/techniques

The Unix/Linux environment




Additional Information : 


Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

description:
If you’re passionate about leading a team that is, committed to the Team Member Experience and driven by innovation and growth, then join us!




The 
Executive Director
 is a critical role within our communities as it impacts the lives of residents through the strong leadership and motivation of Sienna team members.




As an 
Executive Director
 your typical day will impact in the following ways:


Ensuring the Resident Care Mission including philosophy, annual goals and objectives for residents’ care and nursing services are congruent with the organization’s mission statement.

Establishing, implementing, managing and improving standards for nursing care, and policies and procedures for quality resident care to meet individual resident needs and their expectations involving them whenever possible.

Ensures that measures are taken to facilitate optimal occupancy and occupancy numbers.

Monitors preferred accommodation to ensure maximum revenue from achievement of 60% preferred room rentals.

Acts in a leadership capacity to ensure that all team members within the care community foster positive customer service with residents and families in their day to day work.

Acts in a leadership capacity in the development of community partnerships with health service providers, CCAC/ discharge planners, and other community agencies.

Seeks opportunities to ensure a participative working relationship within Local Health Integration Network (LHIN).

Provides leadership and direction to ensure all aspects of Quality Improvement Program are carried out as scheduled (Quality Management plan, corporate indicators, monthly QI schedules, currency of policy & procedure manuals).

Provides oversight for the development & monitoring of the various functions and activities of all accreditation teams within the care community.

Responding promptly to concerns of residents and family members, mediating a satisfactory response to concerns and implements action plans.

Facilitating relationships through effective communications between and among residents, relatives, team members and community to supports involvement and participation in care.

Providing the team members’ development coordination and using the educational resources to plan for an effective team member development program including orientation, in-service and continuing education as determined by the learning needs of nursing team members.

Understands and interprets all components of related legislation for team members, residents and families.

Ensure compliance with all relevant legislation including but not limited to: Ministry Acts, regulations, policies and procedures, directives, & collective agreements.

Ensures the implementation of a complete quality and risk management program in alignment with corporate strategic plan.

Ensure risk management activities take place to reduce and control potential or actual risks to the safety, security and health of all individuals, and to the safety and security of the Care community.

Working in accordance with the organization’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures and in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act.

Planning, coordinating, directing and monitoring the effectiveness of all operational activities of the Care Community.

Provide financial leadership by managing budgets and monitoring long-term strategic fiscal plans, including ensuring sufficient resources/equipment are available through budget preparation, maintenance and the hiring of appropriate and adequate staffing levels.

Maintain an organized system of records management, which includes the components of collection, access, storage, retention and destruction of records, financial, and trust accounts.

Participating in the development of the annual operating budget and reviewing financial statements and taking action on variances to bring expenditures in line with budget.






Must haves:



Post-secondary degree (3 years’) or post-secondary diploma (2 years’) in Health or Social Services.

Must have 3 years’ managerial or supervisory experience in the Health or Social Services industry.

Must have 1-year Long Term Care experience.

Must possess excellent supervisory and leadership abilities (e.g., people management, finance, labour relations, marketing and department coordination).

Highly proficient planning and organizing skills.

Strong problem solving skills.

Strong relationship building skills.

Effective verbal and written English communication skills required.

Strong working knowledge of the Internet and MS Office, specifically Excel and Word.

Applicable to Ontario:

Must have completed a program in Long-Term Care Home Administration that is at least 100 hours in duration of instruction. Possess the qualifications to be an Administrator in the Province of Ontario.

Successful completion of the Fire Safety Planning Training for Owners and Operators in accordance with Ontario Regulation 150/13.

Sound knowledge of Long Term Care Homes Act 2007, Ontario Regulations 79/10.





Act upon your desire to help others and Join Sienna Senior Living as we continue to enhance the lives of those we serve.




Sienna Senior Living is committed to employment equity, diversity, and inclusion in the workplace. In accordance with provincial regulations, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection, and assessment process.

description:
Job Description Summary



The Director of Strategic Marketing & Communications is accountable for the development of One BD approach to align our offerings to deliver outcomes, with a strong focus on the customer, key associations, and aligned to the goals of the region. The role is responsible for utilizing market insights and collaboration with the business units to develop value propositions, messaging and communications that support the regions growth objectives.

In this role, the Director of Strategic Marketing & Communications leads the Region’s Marketing Council which is made up of the Marketing leaders across all three segments to build on the business unit propositions and elevating the marketing function’s capability while driving the One BD messaging through the BD Way of Marketing.

This role serves on the Leadership Team for BD Canada and is a member of the Global Marketing Council.



Job Description




Be part of something bigger!


BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.

The Director of Strategic Marketing & Communications is accountable for the development of One BD approach to align our offerings to deliver outcomes, with a strong focus on the customer, key associations, and aligned to the goals of the region. The role is responsible for utilizing market insights and collaboration with the business units to develop value propositions, messaging and communications that support the regions growth objectives.

In this role, the Director of Strategic Marketing & Communications leads the Region’s Marketing Council which is made up of the Marketing leaders across all three segments to build on the business unit propositions and elevating the marketing function’s capability while driving the One BD messaging through the BD Way of Marketing.

This role serves on the Leadership Team for BD Canada and is a member of the Global Marketing Council.



Responsibilities




Strategic Planning. Work collaboratively with the Leadership Team which includes the Business Unit leaders to formulate the annual strategic plan for Canada. Track industry and market trends, understand healthcare priorities, and integrate voice of customer (VOC) activities in support of building the strategic plan. You are connected with the Corporate Strategy Marketing Team and translate vision/direction to Canada. You keep alive the focus on customer centricity.

Develop key market value propositions that align to key stakeholders for an integrated BDX value offering that includes technology, services, analytics, promoting adoption and optimization of BD solutions.

Develop coach and mentor the regional marketing teams to formulate marketing plans and execute on the marketing process (BD Way of Marketing) and manage and lead team of communications, decisions support and customer facing integration project lead.

Lead and manage team of decision support, communication, program management to develop and execute meaningful BDX partnerships with our customers.

Growth Initiatives. Play a sponsorship/leadership role in the development of key growth strategies and focus for Canada. Identify key markets and customers that support the growth platform.

Market Research. Strong understanding of the marketing research that needs to be done. What drives various stakeholder groups? What data is needed? What are the market dynamics? You have experience working with third party researchers.

Create tools for customer engagements working collaboratively with BU marketing, HEOR and GR teams

Market Development. Identify the key decision makers (clinical, regulatory, policy, etc.) who can shape market conditions. Determine leverage points and behavioral objectives for them and drive the appropriate behaviour change. Lead the development and implementation of our advocacy projects to enable market development for new technologies. Leadership for the management of government or stakeholder policy issues that impact our business. You must be on top of market dynamics, innovation and any news as it relates to the business and make sure you share it with your colleagues. You may even uncover new opportunities – whether it be for products or acquisitions.

Communication. The Director of Strategic Marketing has a strong direct impact on the development and execution of strategies, processes, plans, systems and metrics designed to optimize communications effectiveness at the regional level related to both internal communications and external communications for BD Canada. Often leads project/initiative teams involving complex communications strategies.




Skills And Competencies




Excellent interpersonal skills.

Demonstrated leadership skills.

Advanced ability to develop omnichannel customer engagement models

Expertise in creating value and capturing value through product and portfolio management

Demonstrated capability for strategic thinking, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work with cross-functional teams and to provide marketing leadership within Canadian region

Ability to integrate medical, scientific, and technical information and

Strong communication skills (verbal, presentation, written)

Demonstrated strong customer/client orientation

Demonstrated project and people management skills




Qualifications And Experience




7 years of marketing experience with at least 3 in healthcare, MedTech and or medical device industry.

At least 5 years experience in marketing leadership

Substantial applied marketing managerial experience in multiple disciplines. Experience in Market Assessment, Market Segmentation, Targeted Marketing, Competitive Analysis, Pricing Strategy, Market Development and Go to Market models and strategies.



Education and Training



Bachelor’s or equivalent degree

MBA an asset



For many roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, weekly testing for COVID-19 may be available instead of vaccination. Consistent with BD’s Workplace Accommodations Policy, requests for accommodation will be considered pursuant to applicable law.



Why join us?


A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day.

You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.

To learn more about BD visit


Great Place to Work® has certified our workplace culture based on your feedback in the Trust Index® survey, and we've just published the news about us on their social media channels. You can check these out here. And if you think your friends and networks would be interested in knowing more about your workplace, sharing these posts is a great way to give them some insight!

description:
Staff - Non Union

Job Category

M&P - AAPS
Job Profile
AAPS Salaried - Administration, Level C

Job Title

Director, Finance, HR and Operations

Department

Faculty and Staff | Department of Statistics | Faculty of Science

Compensation Range

6,677.33 - $10,433.50 CAD Monthly

Posting End Date

April 4, 2022

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.


Job End Date




Job Summary



A senior management position, the incumbent is responsible for providing non-academic leadership and directing all administrative activities for the Department of Statistics. Works closely with the Department Head, provides comprehensive leadership, strategic planning and operational direction in all administrative matters, develops and designs effective administrative processes. Oversees operational activities and support services provided to the Department of Statistics. This includes all areas of finance, human resources, office management, physical resources and space planning, research, student programs, workplace health, safety, security, environmental and sustainability, and the budget planning associated with all these activities.

The incumbent provides leadership and direction in establishing and implementing effective policies and procedures to improve the long-term and day-to-day value, quality and effectiveness of operational activities and services. The incumbent anticipates, develops, and designs innovative administrative practices to accommodate current needs and meet future growth of the department. The incumbent also evaluates overall effectiveness to ensure the department’s goals and objectives are met and are consistent with the Department’s overall education and research missions.

The incumbent advises, counsels and provides authoritative information to the Department Head, faculty, managers, staff, and students on human resources, facilities planning, grant and finance administration, and administrative issues ensuring compliance with University policies and practices.

The role of the position is critical for facilitating the achievement of the department goals. The incumbent is expected to be versatile, innovative, creative, and positive in his/her approach to planning and management.


Organizational Status


The Department of Statistics is a fast growing department in the Faculty of Science. The Department provides undergraduate and graduate teaching and training in statistical sciences, not only to students majoring in Statistics but also to students from many other disciplines on campus. In addition to regular credit education programs, the Department, in conjunction with the Department of Computer Science, offers the professional Master of Data Science program (MDS). The Department’s research groups, Applied Statistics and Data Science (ASDa) and Short Term Consulting Services (STCS), provides research support and statistical consulting services to communities within and outside of UBC.

The position reports directly to the Department Head. The incumbent works closely with the Department Head to support achievement of the operational and/or academic goals of the Department.

The incumbent directly supervises three CUPE 2950 staff members in the Main Office. Indirectly manages and/or provides guidance to staff in Department’s IT team. Works closely with the Directors of ASDa and MDS on budget, human resources, and other administrative matters, and provides guidance and training.

The incumbent works with Faculty of Science Dean’s Office, Human Resources, Faculty Relations, Financial Operations, Payroll, ORS, UILO, UBC Immigration Program Office, Building Operations, Campus Planning, Facility Assistant Director in EOAS, Provost Office, VP Research, Relocation Office, and other units or departments at UBC, as well as external granting agencies, contractors and vendors. The incumbent serves on the ESB Security and Safety Committee.

The incumbent collaborates with other administrators in Faculty of Science to exchange information, knowledge, best practices, and opportunities for efficiencies.


Work Performed



Budget Planning, Financial Management, and Research Administration



Manages the departmental budget by planning, implementing and preparing budget submissions, forecasts and summaries for all department operations, facilities and academic programs.

Develops recommendations for overall budgeting and planning in conjunction with Head and Faculty of Science Dean’s Office finance/budget team, assesses alternatives and consequences, assesses impact of surpluses/deficits and reviews variances, ensures cost effectiveness of expenditures, and ensures accurate budget increases and fund transfers

Develops ASDa and STCS operating budgets and manages all aspects of financial management.Provides reports and analyses to the Department Head and Dean’s Office.

Authorizes departmental expense and financial transactions, financial security accesses and internal control.

Monitors all financial transactions for all funds ensuring compliance with university and granting agency policy, budget and accounting constraints.This includes all expenses and purchases, transfers, cash receipts and cost recoveries.

Oversees and authorizes the year-end reconciliation of all accounts.Sets priorities and contingency plans for specific year-end spending and carry forward.

Oversees the management of research grants.Provides authoritative guidance and information to faculty, researchers and their associates on grant opportunities, applications, funding, spending policies/ procedures and termination of grant. Ensures grant holders’ submission of grant applications and renewals are complete within the required timelines.Works with grant holders to determine plans on resolving over-expenditures.



Human Resources Management


Oversees and manages all aspects of human resources activities for faculty, staff and student appointments. Directs all HR management practices within the Department. Provides Department Head and senior management expertise, advice, interpretation and guidance, and ensures compliance with faculty/staff/students collective agreements, UBC and government policies and procedures for all human resources matters.

Provides and delivers department specific materials on orientation, on-boarding and ongoing support. Facilitates and supports equitable, inclusive, safe, security, sustainability, collaborative and respectful workplace


Faculty



Manages all aspects of faculty affairs for all kinds of faculty employment including recruitment, immigration, appointments, reappointments, promotions and tenures, leaves, and salary increase administration.Ensures equitable and appropriate processes are met.

Works closely with the Department Head in the development of policies and procedures that govern these activities in the Department.

Works collaboratively with Faculty Relations and the Faculty of Science Dean’s Office to advise and resolve complex issues.



Staff



Oversees and manages all aspects of staff recruitment, employment, development, discipline, performance evaluation, and termination.

Directs, creates, and implements short and long-term strategic non-academic human resources plans.

Evaluates staffing needs and determine appropriate staffing levels, develops job content and performance standards, determines classification and salary level.Creates and revises position descriptions to accurately reflect the current appropriate tasks and the needs of the Department.

Identifies staff potential and or skills and support professional development.Researches, determines and initiates appropriate training and professional development opportunities.Provides mentoring, team collaboration activities, nurtures a healthy work environment in consideration of both mental health and physical health.

Responsible for attendance and vacation management programs within the Department, ensuring compliance with UBC policy, collective agreements. Ensures employee records are maintained, communications to staff are timely, annual reconciliations and entitlement calculations are accurate.

Works collaboratively with Central HR to advise and resolve complex employee relations issues.



Students



Oversees student appointment activities.Provides advice and guidance on student appointments including visiting student/scholar appointments and Visiting International Research Student.

Reviews and authorizes all student appointments.Ensures salary reimbursements from other UBC units and external sources are received.



Operations



Provides strategic space planning and operational management for the Department.

Develops, recommends, and implements effective change management and strategic priorities to meet new initiatives and evolving needs, and optimize productivity and streamline operational processes for the Department’s day-to-day and long-term value.

Develops, implements and maintains departmental policies and procedures.Keeps abreast of issues, working systems, and information pertaining to overall operations,

Oversees and manages the overall operational infrastructure of the space and facilities occupied by the Department in Earth Sciences Building, and ensures the safety and security of the department members and properties.Serves on the ESB Security and Safety Committee.

Develops and implements departmental plans for safety, security, harassment prevention and protection, hazard free, sustainability, and cleanliness, following guidelines from UBC Risk Management, Investigation Office and other related departments.

Plans and evaluates operational needs of departmental space, facilities, furniture and equipment.Explores options to maximize the use of existing resources and develops redistribution, repurpose and/or reconfiguration plans.Investigates and makes decisions for the lease and purchase of office furniture and equipment.Coordinates equipment repairs and maintenance.

Manages all aspects of major and minor renovations and reconstructions and their associated budgets.Allocates office space.Oversees the authorization of voice services, keys and card access.

In consultation with the Department Head, undertakes special projects.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


The incumbent is expected to exercise a high level of accountability and judgment to fulfill responsibilities and to balance priorities. Effective management of department resources, in the areas of financial, human resource, and facilities management, is critical to maintain the Department’s strong and positive reputation. Poor performance or decision making could result in significant financial losses or operational risk, affecting the Department’s ability to carry out its mission and compromise the reputation of the Department, its programs and the Faculty of Science.


Supervision Received


Reports to the Department Head. The incumbent is self-directed, with full latitude under general guidelines established in conjunction with the Department Head.


Supervision Given


Directly supervises staff in the Main Office. Indirectly manages and provides guidance to staff in IT team and ASDa. Provides general information and training to staff in MDS as needs arise, and direction to external contractors.



Minimum Qualifications



Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of five years of related experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred Qualifications

job_title: Manager, Global Talent Acquisition Strategy & Campus
