description:
Head Office Toronto 
Why join us?


Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition, this role is responsible for consulting and collaborating with a broad range of stakeholders in support of the goals and objectives of Talent Acquisition. The successful candidate will play a critical role in building the Campus & Early Talent Strategy for the global enterprise.

Responsibilities will be in the design, development, delivery, and evaluation of global programs and services that support and build policies and processes to attract and retain top talent while promoting global consistency and alignment to strategic objectives. This role will lead the creation of global Talent Acquisition strategies and programs, with a mandate to advance hiring practices, design new sourcing and recruiting programs, prioritize the new-hire experience across OMERS & Oxford, and strengthen and maintain a driven recruitment brand in the market.



Accountabilities




Leadership



Lead and provide strategic and operational oversight to a team of direct reports to execute on campus recruitment and campus programming.

Act as an escalation point for Talent Acquisition on campus strategy queries, ensuring business and HR teams are aligning strategy with execution efforts.



Global Campus & Strategy



Define global campus recruitment strategies and programs (e.g., collaborate with universities and strengthen reputation) ensuring the acquisition of strong pipeline talent into the organization; navigate the complexity of global markets and align to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy

Create our global New Graduate programs, aligned to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy; ensure best-in-class retention and exceptional new grad experiences

In partnership with People Analytics & Insights team, incorporate workforce data insights into program design and development, create targeted programs based on inclusion and diversity analysis, and develop strategies to monitor impact across the portfolio.



Assessments



Develop a global selection assessment strategy to target the right talent and capabilities, and contribute to a positive candidate experience (e.g., by leveraging artificial intelligence and gamification)

Evaluate the effectiveness, efficiency and new-hire experience of Talent Acquisition processes and identify required changes and updates.



Vendor Management



Own the budget and vendor relationships for the portfolio; Source, approve, and recommend partnerships, new tools, platforms, etc.




Candidate Experience




Own the candidate experience, including onboarding, ensuring OMERS is leveraging best-in-class technologies and approaches

Continuously look to improve candidate, new hire, hiring manager and recruiter experience

Conduct industry research, keeping abreast of the latest news and trends of the recruitment world and providing analysis on the global talent market




Skills & Experience



Undergraduate degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related discipline. 

Experience with leading a team of direct reports including coaching and mentoring

8+ years of demonstrated successful experience in any combination of the following


Full-cycle Talent Acquisition/campus recruitment

Employee value proposition/brand

Candidate experience, employee experience & onboarding programs/practices

New graduate/rotational programs

Social media strategy, and/or;

Talent assessments


Ability to adapt strategy and programs to a frequently changing, complex global context

Knowledge and experience working in a financial services organization and operating model 

Advanced knowledge of human capital trends and best practices 

Demonstrated learning agility and curiosity

Organization-wide program and project design, delivery and evaluation expertise 

Exceptional interpersonal skills to build collaborative relationships with, and influence, leaders at all levels of the organization

Highly skilled at coaching, facilitating, and presenting to a range of audiences 

Strong client-centered and service excellence approach 

Demonstrates strong self-awareness and self-management competencies aligned with organizational values 

Ability to deal effectively with competing and shifting priorities 

Experience with balanced scorecard performance indicators and metrics 

Advanced MS Office applications 

Proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems, preferably Workday

 
Our story 


Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.


 Vaccination Policy 


At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Working with us is more than just a job – it is an opportunity to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. Our employees take great pride in serving the communities in which they live and contributing in a variety of ways to make important community-based initiatives possible globally.

job_title: Senior Manager, Business Development (Renewable Natural Gas)
industries: Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, Oil and Gas, and Utilities
description:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team. 



 At Liberty, we hire passionate people who care about doing the right thing for our customers. We are entrepreneurial, creative, and outcome-focused. Here, your natural talent and achievements will flourish in an inclusive environment of teamwork, trust and continuous learning. We are always pursuing excellence to exceed our ambitions goals, rewarding both the goal outcome and how we achieve it. 


Purpose

Working within Liberty’s Business Development team, the Senior Manager will be a key figure responsible for leading the growth of Liberty’s unregulated Renewable Natural Gas (RNG) business. Reporting to the Director of Business Development, the Senior Manager will be responsible for overseeing the origination, due diligence and execution of new investments in RNG assets, and will take a leading role in the formation of Liberty’s investment strategy in the sector. As a newly created position within the organization, the role offers the highly motivated successful candidate the opportunity to materially influence Liberty’s future growth plans.

Accountabilities


Build and leverage commercial relationships to grow Liberty’s non-regulated Renewable Natural Gas business, originating and executing profitable investments in anerobic digestion, landfill gas, hydrogen and other low-carbon fuel technologies

Work with the Director to ensure that a pipeline of greenfield and acquisition investment opportunities is being developed and systematically evaluated to meet the company’s growth objectives in RNG over a 5 year time horizon

Oversee existing platform investments and developer arrangements to ensure projected levels of organic growth are being achieved through these channels

Take a leading role in commercial negotiations, crafting deal structures with all commercial stakeholders (feedstock suppliers, host farmers/landfills, RNG / environmental attribute offtakers)

Oversee all aspects of acquisition execution, including coordinating with internal and external subject matter experts to ensure all due diligence streams are completed and documented within tight transaction timelines

Take a leading role in developing the investment thesis underlying investment opportunities in execution, and lead the creation of executive level materials for internal approval process

Work closely with the economic analysis group, supervising the financial modelling workstream, and taking overall ownership for valuation methodology

Act as an internal subject matter expert on renewable natural gas markets, including applicable regulations and pathways under the California LCFS program, the Renewable Fuel Standard, and other emerging RNG markets

Work closely with Origination and Energy Services teams to optimize the value of environmental attributes being generated from the portfolio, and build relationships within the C&I offtake market

Use their knowledge of RNG and other renewable fuel markets to provide strategic recommendations on future growth markets and related technologies



Education and Experience


Minimum 10 years of business experience

Minimum 5 years of renewable energy and/or natural gas sector

Minimum 3 years of transaction origination and deal management experience

Experience building and maintaining an external network of commercial contacts and leading negotiations with external counterparties

Experience evaluating complex projects and financial transactions using discounted cash flow models 

Experience structuring and negotiating non-standard commercial contracts

Excellent external and internal relationship building skills with an focus on driving business results

Commercial acumen and the ability to effectively evaluate and solve business challenges

Ability to work well under pressure and meet strict deadlines

Ability to prioritize conflicting deliverables

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Entrepreneurial mindset




 Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally. 



 For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged – Sustaining Energy and Water for Life. 



 Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction. 



 With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our “Think Global, Act Local” business model. 



What We Offer


Company funded Pension program

401k with Company match

Full insurance benefits (helath/dental/vision/life)

Collaborative environment with a genuine flexible working policy

Share purchase/match plan

Defined Contribution savings plan

Top Talent Program

Volunteer paid days off

Employee Assistance Program

Achievement fund

Free parking, including free electrical charging

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not certain you meet the all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to further investigate the opportunity.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value each person’s unique background, diversity, experiences, perspectives and talents. Full participation of all employees in a safe, healthy and respectful environment is key to individual and company success. We are committed to fully utilizing the abilities of all of our employees and expect each of our employees to honor this commitment in their daily responsibilities.

There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making 
it
 possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.

Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.

Job Number: REQ3567

Location: Edmonton or Calgary

Apply by: March 14

Paygrade: K

Leader: Director, CFO Business Process & Architecture



Primary Accountabilities




Process Improvement Specialist - You will be responsible for reviewing business processes to identify potential gaps, redundancies, and opportunities to automate as well as make recommendations for process improvements that support business strategies, optimize performance, and improve the user experience. Using the appropriate Process Improvement methodology for the initiative, you will be responsible for leading all phases of the business improvement cycle - which includes mapping current state, define gaps/challenges, analyze what needs to change, work with relevant subject matter experts to redesign the change and create and execute the change management plan to ensure process adoption, implement, and measure.

Lead and Execute Initiatives - For small and medium sized initiatives you will be accountable for leading all phases of the initiative and the successful adoption of the solution. This includes participating in and/or leading discovery sessions, documenting current state, measuring baseline, and defining project measurables. Moving into the solution refinement phase, you would define and evaluate solutions, present recommendations, and create the initiative execution plan. Moving into the execution and adoption phases, you would create the change management plan (communication, training, documentation), build the roll-out strategy, implement the solution, provide post-Implementation support, and measure benefits against baseline. For large, technology based projects, you will play a key role in the project but resourcing will be commensurate with the resourcing needs of the project, such as a dedicated project manager, developers, and third party resources.

Catalyst for Change - Challenge everything and act as a change champion for advancing the mindset and skills of the future within the areas you support. 

Mentorship - You will act as a mentor and support resource to the Business Analyst. 




Requirements




Business Analyst certification. 

Lean or Six Sigma certification with applicable experience. 

7+ years of experience in Business Analyst roles. 

Direct experience in Agile and project/program management. 

Proficient knowledge in Google Suite and other analytical/statistical (ex. Tableau, JIRA, ARIS, Google App Script).

Strong critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, to recognize and resolve complex issues and devise creative solutions.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to navigate challenging personalities and influence senior leaders.

Ability to build and maintain relationships with team members. 

Knowledge in SQL and database functionality. 

Demonstrated interest in new technologies such as AI and Automation.




Nice To Haves




Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field. 

Proficiency with SAP systems. 

Previous Banking Experience.

Familiarity with Accounting principles. 


At ATB, we know that highly talented people can readily transfer their skills. If you believe your skills and experience are transferable, please consider putting your name in the running.



Benefits




Be great. Be you. Believe.


We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.


What happens next?


Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.

ATB Financial team members are required to disclose their COVID vaccination status and provide proof of vaccination or complete COVID rapid testing as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety. We thank all candidates in advance for their understanding.


Stay in touch!


ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

description:
Position Title: 
Enterprise Architect


 


Our very reputable Insurance Client based in Winnipeg Manitoba is looking for an Enterprise Architect to join their team for a full-time role. The ideal candidate must be willing to live or relocate to Manitoba. 


 


This role will be helping to lead an enterprise-wide Cloud (Azzure) migration journey from it's initial phases to delivery. 


 




SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND SCOPE 




 



Reporting to the Director, Enterprise Architecture, the Enterprise Architect is an advisor to the business, supporting business strategy and planning with a focus on the three-five-year roadmap. This role will be leading an enterprise-wide Cloud Migration journey. 



 



The Enterprise Architect is responsible for establishing the technology strategy and roadmap that enables a portfolio to support current and future business capabilities. This is achieved by working with business owners and Lean Portfolio Management to manage the enterprise portfolio, business epics and technology enablers, linking how change opportunities bring the corporation closer to the five-year ambition.



 



The Enterprise Architect:



· Makes decisions that have a major impact on the Corporation’s ability to attain its strategic directions while maintaining a rationalized portfolio that achieves synergy across the enterprise.



· 
Provides direction to individual work units on what are acceptable tactical objectives and plans how to move from tactical to the strategic architectural objectives.


· 
Works closely with leaders of the corporation to modernize and optimize lines of business and address and respond to market disruptors.


· 
Is responsible for monitoring and adopting technology innovations into the corporation’s technical footprint.

 

The Enterprise Architect needs to keep abreast of technology developments that affect systems, particularly those that are strategic in terms of corporate goals and direction. The position needs to understand how peer companies and agencies are leveraging new technologies, so that the Corporation can be positioned to be a “fast follower”.

 


 NATURE
 
AND
 
SCOPE



 



Enterprise Architecture 70%



· Collaborates with Lean Portfolio Management to provide a high-level vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives.



· 
Reviews, develops, and implements architecture policies and principles.


· 
Builds and maintains a high-level enterprise model of systems, capabilities, and underlying technologies, current and future, that can be the basis for business and IT architecture direction that guides portfolio management.


· 
Assists the Agile Program Management Office (APMO) and Lean-Agile Centre of Excellence (LACE) to identify and design development value streams.


· 
Supports the value streams with adherence to the budget guardrails for retiring solutions (horizon 0).


· 
Participates in the strategy for building and maintaining the architectural runway via Enabler Epics.


· 
Understands and communicates Strategic Themes, and other business drivers for architecture, to System and Solution Architects and non-technical stakeholders.


· 
Drives architectural initiatives via enabler epics in the Portfolio Kanban system and participates in their analysis where applicable.


· 
Influences modelling, design, and coding practices.


· 
Promotes Continuous Delivery Pipeline and DevOps capabilities.


· 
Collects, generates, and analyzes innovative ideas and technologies to use across the business.


· 
Facilitates the reuse of code, components, and proven patterns.


· 
Ensures the implementation of each capability is designed for reuse and is only built once across the enterprise, where possible.


· 
Synchronizes the following disciplines across Solutions whenever applicable:


· 
System and data security and quality


· 
Production infrastructure


· 
Solution user experience (Lean UX)


· 
Non-functional Requirements (NFRs)


· 
Advises senior leaders, business, solution, system and data architects in accomplishing the overall objectives of the Enterprise Architecture.


· 
Communicates vision and leads technical staff in creating components of the Enterprise Architecture.

 


Research and Strategy 15%



· Supports the selection and use of technology, including identifying and monitoring new technologies that may offer opportunities in the future, researching and prototyping through a proof of concept engagement with business partners, understanding the applicability and scope, and assessing the maturity of innovative new technologies.



· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to ensure that individual program and product strategies align with business and technical objectives and satisfy business vision i.e. emerging solutions to local problems are consistent with the overall enterprise strategy.


· 
Develops and maintains plans for infrastructure, working with System Architects to assess the health of the technology, set principles, set in place epic enablers to address health issues and establish roadmaps.


· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to provide oversight to change initiatives, enabling channels of communication for coordination of work between solution and development value streams.


· 
Responsible for building the technical foundation needed to support business epics into the architectural runway delivering enablers just in time to support emerging business capabilities ensuring a continuous delivery pipeline is maintained and does not inhibit delivery velocity.

 


Architecture Matrix Leadership 15%



· Provides leadership to architects (system, data, business, security) on a matrix basis. Provides mentorship, feedback, and direction on approach and work solutions.



· 
Participates in the selection process, as required, and provides input on performance of matrix reporting resources.


· 
Participates in planning and budgeting for special projects and improvement initiatives.


Supports the implementation of new policies and procedures and corporate strategic initiatives 

Identifies training and development needs, ensuring technical expertise of the unit is maintained.

Participates on committees, cross-functional teams, and in meetings and other ad-hoc working groups established to address customer-service issues and initiatives at strategic and operational levels.



 




QUALIFICATIONS




1. Education:



· Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.



· SAFe Architect Certification or commitment to complete within 12 months.



 



2. Experience:



· Seven years of experience in information technology covering a wide range of technologies and disciplines, including:



· 
Five as an architect


· 
Three as a lead architect


· 
Experience of business transformation using lean/six sigma principles is an asset.

 


Technical Knowledge and Skills:



Working knowledge of application development using a variety of technologies including client/server and relational database technology.

Working knowledge of technology deployment using a variety of technologies including networking and platforms.


· Experience in large-scale, enterprise-wide, end-to-end Cloud migration 


· 
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to problem solve and recommend solutions to enhance operations to improve service delivery.


· 
Advanced oral and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information in a concise and straightforward manner, including formal presentations for management and technical staff.


· 
Interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships with business partners.


· 
Working knowledge of project management techniques.


· 
Ability to work in an environment that requires multiple on-going activities, which have tight deadlines and a degree of risk.


· 
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and provide leadership and influence the performance of others.


· 
Ability to solve problems and find creative solutions that meet business needs while maintaining the best interests of the corporation.


· 
Intermediate knowledge of applicable software (Microsoft Office, Project, Visio, SQL, and data analysis / management toolsets, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications).


· 
Working knowledge of insurance corporate systems is an asset.

ABOUT BAM STRATEGY





We are a Digital Experience Agency that thrives on passion and collaboration. We aim to personalize the experience between people and brands, build initiatives that convert, and challenge the norm by asking questions. We're committed to exploring new angles, adapting to ever changing circumstances and moving forward with our team in new and exciting ways. 




We’ve been in the business for 20 years and in the time that we've started, the journey has been phenomenal. Our current client list includes a who’s who of Fortune 500 companies: Pepsi, P&G, 3M, and Reckitt, with a second office located in New York City. What’s our secret sauce, you might ask? We call it “Careiosity.”





OVERVIEW


We are looking for a Lead Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist to support the various Salesforce Marketing Cloud campaigns for the different clients of the Agency. Reporting to the CRM Email Strategy Director, this person has extensive experience using Content Builder, Email Studio, Mobile Studio, Analytics Builder, Automation Studio and Journey Builder.




You will be an early member of a growing team, so get ready to contribute to the development and success of new initiatives and services for the agency - we need a leader with strategic planning and strong analytical skills, insatiable curiosity, and an entrepreneurial spirit.





WHAT YOU WILL DO


Serve as a subject matter expert and key contributor on Marketing Cloud to drive customer engagement and retention strategies and tactics, including customer profiles, segmentation, journey mapping, lifecycle marketing (CRM), marketing automation and the use Einstein in campaign performance optimisation; 





Create workflows, templates and automated processes to run email, PNs and SMS campaigns efficiently within Marketing Cloud.

Use SQL to build audience data for email testing and deployments and to perform ad-hoc analysis and debugging. 

Write AMPscript when needed for email personalization and advanced dynamic content.

Leveraging advanced wide-range Salesforce Marketing Cloud experience and knowledge to provide solutions and direct the application of CRM Strategies.

Select email marketing automation methods, evaluating, adapting of complex techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.

Monitor and report on key metrics, understanding root causes of changes in performance, in order to recommend responsive strategies and tactics.

Enstill strong operational rigour, processing efficiency, and positive morale across the team to ensure standardization and harmonization of workflows across different accounts. 

Collaborate on the development of customer segmentation strategies, and provide campaign performance insights to senior business leadership.

Act as a Marketing Cloud evangelist within the agency, serving as an expert and providing guidance, oversight and training to the Client Services team.






WHAT YOU WILL BRING



3-5 years developing and executing emails and CRM campaigns using Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

Proficient in writing SQL, AMPScript and handling Marketing Cloud.

Asset to have HTML knowledge and Marketing Cloud Certifications.

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related quantitative field (additional specialized training or certifications preferred);

Experience in marketing analytics, data analysis, reporting  or consumer insights;










Key Skills




You are flexible and used to working in a fast paced environment. 

You are skilled at executing B2C email marketing campaigns and implementation projects in Salesforce Marketing Cloud. 

You are experienced in project management, marketing automation platforms  in a high tech environment.

Knowledge of best practices in loyalty programs, email marketing, marketing automation and customer retention, as well as the ability to communicate them to others persuasively;

Ability to interpret data and insights obtained from testing and make iterative optimizations to campaigns and overall marketing strategy;

Highly detail-oriented analytical approach: you are the person who naturally notices flaws in everything and who can suggest ways to improve;

Highly organized: you are able to work autonomously with little guidance and meet project deadlines;

description:
As part of the TELUS Family, GoCo is a next-generation managed IT service provider that offers robust and flexible business communication technology like Unified Communications, Managed Networks and Network Security.

We are on a journey to assemble multiple industry-leading players into the most agile and efficient provider in the Canadian market.

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Director of Network, Cyber and Information Security, Virtualization Specialist is responsible for system administration and virtualization before, during and after the development stages of different products, systems, and data centers. Additionally, The Specialist is Responsible for designing, implementing, monitoring, troubleshooting, installing, and supporting a company's network fabric and virtual server infrastructure.

The responsibilities include, but not limited to assessing, testing, and selecting new products and technologies, defining, implementing, and maintaining servers, storages, systems, operations systems, and guidelines. The specialist will be responsible for consolidation and upgrade different virtual VMware ESXi systems, designing physical and virtual setup for company’s Hyper-converged infrastructure, network fabric based on Cisco switches.

Position Responsibilities:


 Create and execute strategies to improve the reliability of IT systems. 

 Develop unique strategies to implement, support and protect software systems, data centers, and server farms. 

 Work with customers, other IT groups or IT companies if required. 

 Support and diagnosis technical issues involving servers, storages, DNS and other systems. 

 Determine and identify high level functional and technical requirements based on interactions with customers or other internal teams. 

 Deploy and support for installation of company NFVs infrastructure. 

 Manage VMware vSphere environment, which may include network, storage, server infrastructure, application systems and database systems. 

 Act as escalation point on critical server, virtualization issues for other internal teams. 

 Creating and maintaining company server, storage, datacenter documentation. 

 Work closely with the security team to implement security recommendations. 

 Work overtime as required. 

 Participating in regular and adhoc meetings 

 Perform other duties as required. 




Qualifications And Skills



Educational and Job Requirements:


 A bachelor's degree in computer science, or a related field 

 5 years of experience in a similar role 

 Ideal candidate will be VMware certified - VMware Implementation Expert (VCP or VCAP) 

 Ideal candidate will be Cisco certified – Cisco CCIE or CCNP DC 

 Good knowledge of SAN Storage (Dell EMC, HPE) is a benefit 

 Good knowledge of VMware Backup Systems (Veeam) is a benefit 


Experience and Skill Requirements:


 Excellent knowledge regarding TCP/IP and Ethernet, virtualization, network, storage 

 6+ years’ experience with VMware technologies: vSphere, vSAN, Cloud Director 

 3+ years’ experience with Enterprise network concepts and datacenters, routing, NFV 

 Experience architecting and deploying large VMware ESXi based solutions. 

 Knowledge of Windows and Linux OSes, DNS, DHCP 

 Enterprise server hardware experience (Cisco HyperFlex, Dell and HP servers) 

 Enterprise storage hardware experience (HP 3PAR, Dell EMC, QNAP, NetApp) 

 In-depth knowledge of architecture, engineering, and operations of VMware Cloud, Microsoft Active Directory, SDN, ACI, virtual datacenter technologies 

 Experience deployment and configuration HCI clusters 

 Experience with PowerShell, scripting 

 Working knowledge with Microsoft Azure 

 Knowledge of VMware NSX, vRealize 

 Good knowledge of Veeam and other backup systems 

 Ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced and ever-changing environment. 

 Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, project management and organizational skills. 

 A keen interest in learning and continuous improvement of processes and systems. 

 Familiar with PRTG, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft Azure 


Additional Information about the Role:


 Canadian permanent residency or citizenship, temporary work permit 

 Occasional travel to company's datacenters located across Canada. 

 Occasional calls or meetings with customers and IT vendors 

 The candidate will be part of sysadmin team pager duty (extra pay) 

 Company provides a competitive benefit package (insurance, bonus, remote work (temporary or permanent), personal well being days etc.) 


NOTE: The health and safety of our team, customers and communities is paramount to GoCo. Accordingly, we require anyone joining our team to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.


Please note that the selected candidate is required to successfully complete a background check.


Only candidates residing in Canada and in possession of the necessary status or valid work permit will be considered.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Accessibility

GoCo is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process.

description:
IT - Project Manager




Our client is a leading and growing Canadian company within the services industry and they have an immediate need for an IT Project Manager. Reporting to the Director, Project Management Office, this role will plan, execute, and finalize enterprise projects according to strict deadlines and within budget using PMI methodologies. This includes acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects according to plan. The Project Manager will also define the project’s objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle.








RESPONSIBIITIES



 



Strategy & Planning



 



Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.

Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.

Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.

Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders.

Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.

Track project milestones and deliverables.

Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the project team, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas.

Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.

Conduct project post mortems and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements.

Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management.



 



Acquisition & Deployment



 



Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.

Draft and submit budget proposals, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary.

Where required, negotiate with other department managers for the acquisition of required personnel from within the company.

Determine and assess need for additional staff and/or consultants and make the appropriate recruitments if necessary during project cycle.



 



Operational Management



 



Direct and manage project development from beginning to end.

Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.

Delegate tasks and responsibilities to appropriate personnel.

Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team.

Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.

Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.

Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.

Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.

Build, develop, and grow any business relationships vital to the success of the project.













 
REQUIREMENTS



 



University degree or college diploma. Working knowledge of the PMBOK guide and methodologies

10 years direct work experience in a project management capacity, including all aspects of process development and execution

Experience managing projects exceeding $10M

Strong familiarity with project management software

Knowledge of smartsheet and asset

Working knowledge of a Microsoft environment

Understanding of software development methodologies

Understanding of Change Management and Change Management principals

Technically competent with various software programs and solid working knowledge of current Internet technologies

Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential

Strong written, presentation and oral communication skills.

Strong interpersonal, relationship management and customer service skills

Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.

Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.

Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines.

Some travel required





If you are interested in this opportunity, please forward your resume to ray.sacuevo@redbranchsearch.com

description:
About Us


Airbase is the first all-in-one spend management platform that provides companies unparalleled control and visibility into every dollar spent. Finance teams deserve a solution that eliminates the tedious work involved in managing spend and allows them to focus on being strategic partners to the rest of the business. We do that by replacing the multiple systems typically used to manage spend with a single platform that handles every workflow including expense approvals and payments (physical cards, virtual cards, ACH, check), while also automating away the bulk of spend-related accounting. Learn more about why innovative companies like Gusto, Segment, Doximity, Getaround, Netlify, and more trust Airbase at www.airbase.com


About The Job


The Manager of Customer Success leads and develops a team of high-performing Customer Success Managers (5-7 team members), specifically for our SMB and Mid-Market segments, providing relationship leadership and enablement to drive exceptional expansion and renewal outcomes. This role requires experience in recruiting, developing, directing, and retaining a high-performing Customer Success team that ensures an outstanding, industry-best, customer experience throughout the evolving lifecycle of our product(s). Success in this role is defined by contributions to increasing the customer’s lifetime value through greater depth in product usage, expansion into new products, increased customer NPS and health scores, and the growth and development of your team.

Reporting to the Director of Customer Success, this manager will assist the Director in leading a growing team of Customer Success Managers through a transition into a world-class, proactive Customer Success Organization that strategically partners with customers to drive value to achieve customer objectives. In fact, you’ll help them obsess over it. This role will work cross-functionally to amplify the voice of the customer to other departments and drive process improvements with those departments to continually improve the customer experience. This Manager will also assist the Director in creating a strong team culture of winning and delivering delight to customers.


What You'll Do



Lead, train and empower a team of 5-7 CSMs to retain and grow their customer portfolios in a full-time, remote environment.

Create and nurture a positive, engaged and happy team culture.

Iterate on the existing customer journey and leverage our Customer Success tool, Catalyst, to enable the team as they scale.

Work with the Director of Customer Success to refine KPIs; develop health scores and automate reporting on success and churn indicators to share across Revenue leadership; use analytics to assist in predictive forecasting for team performance.

Constantly evaluate, identify and collaborate with management to implement the best approach to customer segmentation, team organization, team incentives, technology, and processes to deliver a great customer experience.

Lead by example and promote the importance of creating trusted advisor relationships with Customers’ executive sponsors that enable and lead to strategic partnerships and align with our business and strategy.

Design retention strategies, based on company strategy, to reduce churn and to improve long-term account expansion across SMB and Mid-Market customer segments.

Develop a culture of customer obsession and accountability, striving for nothing less than 100% customer satisfaction and retention.

Be an expert on best practices in change management.

Recruit and hire a world-class team of CSMs, guide their onboarding and obsess over their growth as strategic partners for our customers.




What We're Looking For



2+ years as a team lead or manager at a fast-growing SaaS company.

Experience using Salesforce, coaching technology and managing a Customer Success software (Catalyst, Totango, Churnzero, etc).

Demonstrated track record of succeeding in a results-driven environment that directly impacts the growth of our business.

Strong understanding of start-up growth stages, fundraising, etc. 

A passion for delighting customers and the members of your team.

Experience working with finance teams and accountants a plus.

Experience working and leading in a fully remote environment desirable.



We offer competitive cash compensation and equity. We're a remote team and are happy to work with candidates from anywhere in the world.

While people dream of a better energy future, Peak Power is building it. Founded in 2015, Peak has developed a comprehensive software platform that alleviates strain on the electricity grid and drives value to owners of clean energy assets, buildings, and electric vehicles (EVs). Our Synergy software platform optimizes the operation of distributed energy resources by forecasting and predicting the behavior of electricity markets.


The Opportunity


Reporting to the Director of Strategy & Corporate Development, you will be a key member of Peak’s Corporate Development team and will be instrumental in driving the next phase of Peak’s success. You will contribute to the development, implementation and execution of key business strategies and initiatives, and support the team in achieving sustained growth for the company. You have exceptional presentation skills and will bring a strong background in strategy and analytics to the team. In addition, you will have strong relationship-building skills, building rapport with key people at varying levels of the organization.


The Analyst, Strategy and Corporate Development will:



Develop. You will develop performance measurement and monitoring systems for Peak and assist with their implementation across department, and output regular management reports on goals and initiatives progress, sales, emissions abatement, innovation metrics, etc., for Peak’s executives and investors.

Deliver. You will deliver executive-level reports and presentations summarizing key market trends and recommendations to accelerate the growth of the company, which may include new market developments, competitive intelligence, investment market analysis, customer discovery insights, maintaining competitor and partnership databases, and so on.

Collaborate. You will collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization and departments to execute on key initiatives such as assisting in innovation funding activities, capital raise activities, completing growth projections, and external market analyses. 

Grow. As a cross-functional member of the company, you will become a core part of a high-growth Canadian cleantech company and have influence across various stakeholder groups such as Software Engineering, Product, Sales, Finance and Corporate Leaders. 




What you bring to Peak Power:


The education and experience.


You bring 2-3 years of related work experience, ideally within corporate development, a corporate venture team, venture capital, or private equity. 

A Degree in Engineering or Commerce, with specializations in strategy, operation, economics, or a related field is preferred.

Knowledge of or demonstrated interest in the renewable energy, sustainability, GHG and clean technology sectors. 


The expertise. You have exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills, with the ability to translate unstructured and varied data into clear and actionable insights. 

The drive and curiosity. You bring an entrepreneurial spirit, with a track record for delivering results in fast-moving and demanding environments, and a passion for technology solutions at the bleeding edge of innovation. 




So why Peak Power?


We are focused on solving problems that impact energy markets both locally and around the world. We are a growth-stage clean technology company that has partnered with major names in real estate, electricity, and smart city spaces. To work with us is not only to work with an exciting company, but to also be on the cutting edge of the global transition to distributed, clean, and carbon-free energy.


Join us! 


Apply here or learn more about our company from our or .

Peak Power is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

description:
Description



Aimeriez-vous travailler avec la direction des ventes sur les analyses financières opérationnelles et commerciales? Souhaiteriez-vous travailler sur la modélisation, la production de rapports et les prévisions financières, ainsi que la qualité des données et le soutien aux opérations relativement à la clientèle? Amazon Web Services (AWS) recherche un directeur des activités commerciales qui occupera un rôle central dans notre organisation pour le secteur public. Vous occuperez un poste décisif et travaillerez en collaboration avec un directeur des ventes et d'autres dirigeants concernés sur l'organisation commerciale, les bonnes pratiques et la croissance d'AWS. Notre équipe s'efforce également de soutenir ses nouveaux membres. Les niveaux d'expérience et d'ancienneté de nos équipes sont très divers, et nous favorisons un environnement du partage des connaissances et du mentorat.

En tant que directeur des activités commerciales, vous serez responsable de la formalisation des rapports financiers et commerciaux d'AWS Canada pour le secteur public. Vous établirez des tableaux de bord, des critères opérationnels et des rapports afin de gérer la croissance rapide des activités d'AWS pour le secteur public. Vous dirigerez également les activités commerciales, telles que la production des rapports d'activités mensuels et trimestriels, l'examen des pipelines, la gestion des opportunités ainsi que l'élaboration d'autres critères et rapports périodiques.

Le directeur des activités commerciales collabore avec les responsables des ventes pour prévoir et évaluer la réalisation des quotas de vente. Il soutient l'exécution des activités en fonction des commissions et des quotas planifiés, des territoires définis, des mouvements de comptes, des rapports et des informations à l'attention de la direction des ventes. Le directeur des activités commerciales réfléchit de manière stratégique et agit de façon tactique. Il dispose d'un bon jugement critique et de solides compétences analytiques. Il entretient d'étroites relations de travail, dispose de compétences organisationnelles et fait preuve d'une capacité à structurer et contrôler. Il sait communiquer avec divers types de parties prenantes (avec ou sans connaissances techniques) issues de différentes régions.



Principales Responsabilités




 Gérer les analyses et rapports financiers pour un secteur d'activités public, en veillant à l'exactitude, à la précision et au respect des échéances.

 Définir des critères et produire des rapports pour gérer les pipelines de ventes, les produits facturés et la réalisation des quotas.

 Diriger l'élaboration de modèles et méthodes de prévision sur la base de l'analyse quantitative des performances des équipes de vente.

 Mettre au point des tableaux de bord de performances qui englobent les principaux critères.

 Rédiger des exposés et diriger la création des rapports d'activités trimestriels.

 Émettre des recommandations et soutenir l'évolution, l'intégration et la mise en œuvre de la veille stratégique et des outils de gestion des relations avec la clientèle.

 Diriger la planification territoriale, la segmentation des comptes et l'élaboration des quotas.

 Gérer le processus de planification locale et exécuter une routine opérationnelle : rapports d'activités trimestriels et mensuels, 2x2, planification opérationnelle, ateliers stratégiques extérieurs, etc.

 Gérer le suivi et la direction des effectifs.


Are you interested in working with Sales leadership on operations and business financial analysis? Do you find it interesting to work with customer financial modeling, reporting, forecasting, data quality and operations support? We at Amazon Web Services (AWS) are hiring within our Public Sector (PS) organization for a pivotal Business Operations Manager (BOM) role. You will have significant impact, working with a sales director and related leaders on business orchestration, best practices, and AWS growth. Our team is also dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

As a BOM, you will lead formalization of the financial and business reporting for AWS Canada PS. You will establish dashboards, operational metrics, and reports to manage the rapid growth of AWS PS business. You will also be responsible for driving business activities such as monthly and quarterly business reviews, pipeline reviews, opportunity management and other periodic reporting and metrics. The BOM collaborates with sales managers to evaluate and forecast attainment against quotas, plus supports business execution regarding commission and quota plans, territory definitions, account movements, and reporting and insights for sales leadership.

The BOM will think strategically, act tactically, and display strong analytical and critical thinking skills. You will have strong working relationships, organizational skills, and ability to establish structure/control. You are able to communicate well across geographies and stakeholder types (technical or non-technical).



Key Responsibilities Include




 Managing PS financial reporting and analysis for a business vertical, ensuring timeliness, completeness and accuracy of reporting

 Developing metrics and reports to manage sales pipeline, billed revenue and quota attainment

 Leading development of forecast models/methodologies, owning quantitative analysis of sales team performance

 Developing performance dashboards that encompass key metrics

 Authoring narratives and leading the creation of quarterly business reviews

 Making recommendations and supporting the evolution, integration, and implementation of business intelligence and CRM tools

 Leading territory planning, account segmentation & quota development

 Managing local planning process and running operational cadence: quarterly and monthly business reviews, 2x2s, operational planning, offsite strategy workshops, et al.

 Managing headcount tracking and management


Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional lives is crucial to your happiness and success at Amazon, so we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life.

A day in the life



About The Hiring Group



Job responsibilities



About Us



Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.




Basic Qualifications




 Au moins 7 ans d'expérience dans la finance, la gestion opérationnelle ou la direction commerciale, dans des organisations mondiales de vente de taille moyenne ou grande.

 Au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans le développement et la mise en œuvre de systèmes, de processus et d'outils pour la gestion des relations avec la clientèle, la rémunération variable, la prévision des recettes et la production de rapports sur les recettes.

 Au moins 2 ans d'expérience d'utilisation des outils de veille stratégique et des logiciels de gestion des relations avec la clientèle.

 Au moins 3 ans d'utilisation de Salesforce.

 Diplôme universitaire ou collégial de quatre ans, ou expérience de travail supplémentaire équivalente. Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication écrite et verbale, en français et en anglais.

 7+ years of experience in finance, business management or sales operations, in medium to large global sales organization

Strong verbal and written communication skills, in French and English



Preferred Qualifications

 Excellente maîtrise d'Excel pour l'élaboration de rapports ad hoc complexes, avec notamment des tableaux croisés dynamiques, des macros et la production automatisée de rapports.

 Excellentes aptitudes à communiquer à l'oral comme à l'écrit et capacité à travailler de manière efficace au sein d'organisations internes et externes

 Expérience des modèles opérationnels de revenus récurrents; capacité à prévoir le comportement des marchés en fonction de règles statistiques et de modèles mathématiques.

 Expérience dans l'industrie des TI, avec une connaissance particulière des tendances en matière de nuage.

 Expérience de travail dans une entreprise à forte croissance dans le domaine des technologies.

 Connaissance du secteur public et des achats publics, ainsi que des politiques et mandats régissant le processus.

 MBA spécialisé dans les affaires ou la finance.

 Esprit d'initiative, capacité à accomplir pleinement des tâches multiples avec un sens des priorités.

 Capacité à mener des analyses pointues et créatives de données complexes et à traduire les résultats en informations, messages et présentations exploitables.

 Capacité à agir avec succès dans une organisation agile et dynamique qui évolue rapidement.

 Sens des affaires, solides compétences d'analyses et capacité éprouvée à prendre des responsabilités et à diriger des analyses orientées sur les données pour soutenir et développer une entreprise.

description:
JOB OVERVIEW:


This is an important and high-profile role within IQVIA. Associate Clinical Project Management Directors drive the delivery of our studies and aid in bringing new therapies to market faster to ultimately improve patients’ lives. It is a position that requires strong vendor management skills and direct liaison across IQVIA functions and with the customer, acting as that accountable point for delivery and quality while maintaining financial control.

As an Associate Clinical Project Management Director you will manage cross functional teams across our global organization. You will be supported by domain experts in every function and enabled by best-in-class technology and data analytics. Key collaborators are the Clinical Lead for site management, the Project Management Analyst for project coordination, tracking and financial analysis and the Site Activation Manager an expert in start-up. IQVIA’s size and global footprint will present you with the breadth of opportunities necessary to develop your career.

You will need to be comfortable collaborating and communicating with a variety of colleagues and clients and demonstrate flexible and creative leadership. Global experience and a biopharmaceutical, CRO or related vendor (IP supply, clinical laboratory, etc.) is ideal.


While project assignments vary, your typical responsibilities might include:



Serving as the primary project contact with the client

Leading and managing cross-functional project teams

Project status reporting and surveillance for risk

Monitoring team performance against contract and client expectations and according to key performance metrics

Leading problem solving including management of risk and issue resolution

Developing or reviewing study management plans

Managing team resource assignments and accountability

Oversight of database management

Ensuring compliance with study tools, training materials and standard processes, policies and procedures.




Minimum Required Education And Experience




Bachelor's degree in life sciences or related field and 10 years’ clinical research experience including 6 years’ project management experience and experience in clinical operations; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.




Physical Requirements




Extensive use of keyboard requiring repetitive motion of fingers.

Extensive use of telephone and face-to-face communication requiring accurate perception of speech.

Regular sitting for extended periods of time.

May require occasional travel.


At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world.
