description:
The engineering team at Ritual is a small and tight-knit unit. We are driven to deliver high-quality software as quickly as possible to our end users. We are extremely data-driven in our decisions about the product and constantly iterate to provide the best customer experience. We are problem solvers, while remaining business-minded and customer-focused.




We are mostly a Java shop hosted on Google Cloud Platform with most of our services in Kubernetes. Our data layer is mainly in MySQL and Redis. Our customers interact with the application through native iOS and Android apps as well as a web interface (React). We take a project-based agile approach to software development. We use Grafana, Stackdriver, and PagerDuty for our monitoring and alerting. We use Bazel as the build system for our backend services, along with Jenkins and Python for our CI/CD and automation tooling.




This role is a Site Reliability Engineer with a focus on cloud infrastructure for Kubernetes services. Your typical day involves working with the infrastructure team to solve complex issues around system reliability, operations, and deployment.





As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Ritual….





You will help us design and build scalable and reliable services to support our growing business. We are looking for someone with a passion for developing mission-critical software that creates simple abstractions for complex infrastructure. If you are passionate about scalability and performance, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and are excited to learn, we’d like to talk to you.

Technical leadership at Ritual requires impact and ownership. A senior site reliability engineer at Ritual is expected to be effective in the following areas:



Contribute to architecture.
 You understand large areas of our system and are able to reuse or add new components to existing architecture. You have a passion for the latest cloud technologies.


Scalability and performance.
 You are always mindful of scalability and demonstrate a meaningful understanding of scalable design and performance choices.


From requirement to delivery.
 You work independently or as part of a team that can quickly turn requirements into testable production ready code.


Post Delivery.
 You have a good knowledge of our deployment pipelines. You stay accountable for the deployment after going live into production; always looking into improving our processes around pushing releases to production. You are proactive in monitoring/alerting of the services you own and are always passionate about observability of our system.


Code quality & code review.
 You have passion for quality code and maintain a high standard of style; enforce/update existing patterns


Team oriented.
 You build tools that make the whole team more productive. Improve tools and processes when needed.


Knowledge transfer & mentorship.
 You share the knowledge you've gathered and help the rest of the team grow






We’re looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer that has…






BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience

6+ years of experience as a site reliability engineer, infrastructure engineer, or cloud security engineer

Experience working with Infrastructure-as-Code and managing cloud environments

Experience with cloud observability and monitoring services

Experience in writing CI/CD pipelines and automation tooling

Operational experience with Kubernetes or container orchestration systems

Preference for experience with database design and SQL






Bonus points for…






Experience developing software in a high-level programming language such as Java/Python/Go/Groovy

Applied knowledge of security best practices in cloud environments

Being the security advocate for improvements on the SRE/Cloud infrastructure team

Linux system administration and networking

Large systems software design experience

A Github account with cool projects in it






Who you’ll work with:





Reza Manbachi, Director of Software Engineering

Stephen Dong, Sr. Software Engineer

Adrian Gudas, Sr. Site Reliability Engineer

Mo Adi, Staff Backend Engineer





What we offer:






Contribute to a lifestyle-changing consumer product used worldwide

Ritual credits to spend anywhere

Healthcare coverage from day one, and a flexible vacation policy (Need time? Take time)

Equity in the business - ownership is a key value at Ritual and we want you to share in our long-term success

Be at the heart of the growth startup community

Work with truly elite peers in a super-fun office (remotely for now!)






About Ritual:



 


Ritual delivers more than just an avenue to skip the lunch line - we serve up a true community experience, helping you connect with your social circle and local businesses via seamless technology, all built around what humans love most - food. Founded in 2014 by three serial entrepreneurs, we’re about a seamless ordering process, helping you discover hidden gems in your community, and connecting with your peers through seamless ordering. We help small businesses thrive in a digital culture with the ease and convenience of push button ordering, while retaining the human connection that makes local shops special. We believe we’re making a positive cultural impact on a global scale - and our investors do, too: we’ve raised over $140M in funding, helping us bring Ritual to nearly 50 cities across North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. Hungry for more? Visit us at https://ritual.co/





Ritual fosters and welcomes diverse teams and ideas: ideas that are new, different, and game-changing. We constantly strive to live up to our core values of authenticity, open-mindedness, and focusing on impact. We aim to build a culture where difference is valued, every team member has a seat at the table, and all voices are heard. It is thus our mission to attract and cultivate diverse perspectives by empowering our people to bring their authentic selves to work every day. 






We are committed to continuous improvement, and a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates engaging in Ritual’s selection and interviewing process.

Marketing Generalist




Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5 pm with flexibility 




Full-Time, Permanent, Mid-Level


Salary:
 $50-60K


DEADLINE
: March 13th, 2022


LOCATION:
 1-5295 John Lucas Dr, Burlington, ON L7L 6A8




Do you have a passion for marketing strategy, planning, and everything that comes along with it? Do you consider yourself a “do-er” who would never get caught without your notebook? If so, ROOTREE is looking to fill the role of Marketing Generalist. 

Our internal creative and marketing agency is a dynamic, collaborative, fast-paced, project-based environment that’s focused on branding & identity, package design, digital marketing, e-commerce web design, and social media management. Our team serves as the internal marketing team for Rootree as well providing these services to our clients. The goal of the Creative Services team is to fulfill all of our clients’ creative needs in one place.

Reporting to the Creative Director & Marketing Manager, the ideal candidate believes that every good marketing strategy first needs the foundation of a proper plan. You enjoy getting into the moving pieces of a plan and setting up your team for success by ensuring they have all the details needed to start a project. You enjoy not only creating the strategy and the plan, but also implementing the digital marketing pieces to achieve success. Working on multiple projects at once comes naturally to you, you are great at meeting deadlines, and can easily shift priorities. You get fulfillment out of helping others - the team’s success is your success. You enjoy being challenged, are eager to learn and develop skills, work towards goals, and exceed expectations. You have excellent interpersonal and client-focused skills, and are not afraid to ask questions, shout out ideas, or raise concerns. 




Skills & Experience

You have:


Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, communications, business administration, or related fields (required).

3+ years of working experience in a marketing and communications agency, or in-house marketing role.

3+ years of professional experience using Facebook and Instagram for a business or organization.

3+ years of digital media buying experience for SEM and paid social, including evaluating and reporting on performance.

3+ years of email service provider (ESP) or omni-channel platform experience.

3+ years of experience using project management software, such as Monday, Asana, Basecamp, etc.

Working knowledge of SEM, SEO, CRM, ROI, and KPI’s

Excellent verbal and exceptional written communication skills.

Excellent implementation skills, with a focus on making strategy come alive through good execution.

The ability to feel comfortable working ‘behind the scenes’ with processes and taking care of the details so nothing falls through the cracks.

Proven project management skills - managing multiple projects/initiatives with the ability to adapt and prioritize multiple tasks and situations. Creative problem solving skills and are comfortable collaborating with team members and thinking outside of the box.

The ability to receive direction and constructive feedback, as well as provide it to other team members in a collaborative way.





Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will be:


Be the pillar of support to the Creative Director & Marketing Manager in all facets of the marketing realm.

Assist in developing, overseeing, and executing Rootree’s brand strategy.

Maintain general oversight of all Rootree marketing initiatives and communications – review copy for spelling, grammar, brand voice, and keywords. 

Build high-level marketing campaigns, enter tasks and timelines into the team’s project management system, “Monday.com”, task upkeep, and work with other team members across all departments to ensure deadlines are met.

Collaborate with other teams and departments to gain a mutual understanding of goals, propose and execute marketing strategies to help find efficiencies in workflow.

Plan and build email marketing automation journeys.

Work collaboratively with external media partners, execute development of paid media campaigns, and manage the setup and ongoing monitoring of PPC and paid social media campaigns.

Perform A/B Tests, refine strategies, audiences, and report on performance.

Monitor and report on performance of all marketing campaigns against goals (ROI and KPIs) and provide actionable insights and recommendations for future improvements

Generate marketing reports for all online digital marketing efforts.

Participate in planning customer journey mapping and collect data.

Build g digital marketing strategy and plans in collaboration with the Creative Director and Marketing Manager.

CRM upkeep – Dot Digital/NetSuite.

Follow up on initiatives with team members across all departments.

Work as a collaborative team member, creating and executing innovative marketing strategies.

Set your own project schedules and work within them to meet deadlines.

Build a strong understanding of our clients and what motivates the user's experience/behaviour.

Participate in client meetings to gain an understanding of client goals and project deliverables.






All applicants are required to submit a resume and cover letter, including a personal introduction. Chosen applicants may be asked to complete a short technical challenge to demonstrate their unique skills and creativity.





Rootree has implemented contact tracing, cleaning, distancing, and masking protocols in our facility - these protocols are reviewed and adjusted as needed. Our new team member will be required to work in the office until onboarding is complete and the team member shows confidence and knowledge of our business practises, at which time a hybrid work model may be available, at management’s discretion. All team members are expected to follow our standard COVID protocols that are in place at time of employment. 




About Rootree

Rootree is Canada's leading manufacturer of environmentally responsible flexible packaging. Operating as one efficient, integrated system, we offer many services under one roof; our main branches include Creative Services, Flexible Packaging (manufacturing), and Contract Packing.

On behalf of our family, our community, and our planet, we work every day to reshape the packaging industry. We are continually investing in green technologies and adopting sustainable manufacturing procedures that allow us to produce with up to 75% less waste than our conventional competitors.    

Rootree is in an exciting time of growth! We have recently amalgamated our office and manufacturing facility in a new head office in Burlington. We are also in the process of designing our brand-new, state-of-the-art LEED Gold head office in North Burlington, to be constructed within the next two years. 

If you're energized by making a real difference as part of a winning team, we want to hear from you!





How to Apply


To apply, please submit resume and cover letter via email to hello@rootree.ca with the subject line MG2022. 


Thank you for your interest in Rootree. For the safety of our employees, we are only accepting applications by email. Additionally, only potential candidates will be contacted back for an interview. Follow us on LinkedIn to stay current on our job opportunities. 



Please note, our hiring process requires reference checks and a police check. References will be required prior to an offer being forwarded. Police checks are required, if hired, within three weeks of the start date. Please note, police checks are not used to disqualify candidates.  



Rootree is committed to removing accessibility barriers and meeting legislative requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing accommodations should they be required.

job_title: Support Technician/ Phone System & Network Administrator / Technicien de soutien système téléphonique/administrateur réseau
industries: Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Value Proposition


As a leading partner in healthcare, Medline Canada's sole purpose is Together Improving Lives – this means being deeply committed to the health and well-being of our customers, employees, partners and our communities. We employ a diverse group of top talent focused on growing and making a difference in the lives of Canadians, coast-to-coast.

Compensation is only one part of the Employee Value Proposition that Medline Canada offers our employees. As part of our mission, we offer one of the most competitive and engaging employee experience programs in Canada, which includes:


Collaborative work environment with highly engaged employees

Market competitive compensation and benefits plan, including LTD & Insurance

DPSP match program

Annual Employee Appreciation Week

Paid vacation and personal days

Lifeworks® Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Resources supporting mental, physical, family and financial well-being

Career growth and training programs

Open communication with Senior Leaders

Tailored incentives for eligible employee groups, such as home office reimbursement and Sylvan Learning Centre credit

Employee referral program

Education support programs

Fitness subsidy

Recognition programs

Social activities

And much more…




Job Summary


Reporting to the IT Director, the Support Technician/Phone System & Network Administrator is responsible of maintaining and troubleshooting network, workstations and telephone systems. This role is also responsible for procuring, installing, and configuring software, hardware and other technologies.


Core Job Responsibilities



Maintain the network system, printers and workstations 

Maintain telephone system and mobile hardware

Maintain multiple server throughout the company (mail, file, etc)

Liaise with A/C technician and electricians to ensure office is properly outfitted 

Set up, monitors and updates computer security and firewalls 

Assist with sales meetings, presentations, and exhibitions as required by procuring and implementing technologies for audio/visual conferencing

Complete work within expected periods of time 

Have minimum absenteeism and be punctual 

Maintain good workplace housekeeping 

Complete other duties as assigned 




Qualifications



Knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory and Exchange Administration

Good knowledge in MAC, OSX and IOS

Understanding of laser and zebra printers configuration

Understanding of RF scanner configuration

Ability to administer DNS configuration

Previous experience with SAP considered an asset

University / College diploma

Ability to deploy wired networks considered an asset ( certification required)

1-3 years in a comparable position




About Medline Canada


Medline Canada stands at the forefront of healthcare, providing expertise and a breadth of solutions for every care setting. With 550+ employees, including 100 dedicated sales and clinical professionals and eight distribution centres located coast-to-coast, Medline Canada is proud to serve the entire continuum of care.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusivity


Medline Canada is committed to diversity and inclusivity and we encourage applications from members of groups that have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples, Indigenous peoples of North America, racialized persons/persons of colour and those who identify as women, persons with disabilities and LGBTQ+ persons.


Our commitment to Accessibility


Medline Canada is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). We endeavor to make our recruitment, assessment and selection processes as accessible as possible and provide accommodations as required for applicants with disabilities. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact HRCanada@medline.com.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.


Proposition de valeur


La mission de Medline Canada, partenaire important en matière de soins de santé, consiste à travailler ensemble afin d’améliorer des vies. Cela signifie que nous sommes entièrement engagés envers la santé et le bien-être de nos clients, de nos employés, de nos partenaires et de nos communautés. Nous embauchons un groupe diversifié de talents et visons l’objectif de faire une différence dans la vie des Canadiens, d’un océan à l’autre, sans toutefois nuire à nos aspirations de croissance.

La rémunération n’est qu’une partie de la proposition de valeur que nous présentons aux employés de Medline Canada. Dans le cadre de notre mission, nous offrons un des meilleurs programmes d’expérience d’employé, qui est à la fois concurrentiel et engageant. Celui-ci comprend ce qui suit :


Environnement de travail collaboratif avec des employés hautement motivés

Rémunération et programme d’avantages sociaux concurrentiels sur le marché, comprenant notamment une assurance d’invalidité à long terme

Programme de contribution égale du régime de participation différée aux bénéfices

Semaine annuelle d’appréciation des employés

Congés personnels et vacances payés

Programme d’assistance aux employés (PAE) Lifeworks®, ressources de soutien mental, physique, familial et financier

Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de formation

Communications ouvertes avec la haute direction

Mesures incitatives adaptées aux groupes d’employés admissibles, comme des remboursements des dépenses de bureau à domicile et des crédits du Sylvan Learning Centre

Programme de recommandation d’employé

Programme d’aide à l’éducation

Aide à la santé physique

Programmes de reconnaissance

Activités sociales

Et plus encore!





SOMMAIRE DE L’EMPLOI



Relevant du directeur informatique, le Technicien de support/administrateur système téléphonique et réseau est responsable de la maintenance et du dépannage du réseau, des postes de travail et des systèmes téléphoniques. Ce rôle est également responsable de l'approvisionnement, de l'installation et de la configuration des logiciels, du matériel et d'autres technologies.



RESPONSABILITÉS DE BASE DE L’EMPLOI




Maintenir le système réseau, les imprimantes et les postes de travail

Maintenir le système téléphonique et le matériel mobile

Maintenir plusieurs serveurs dans toute l'entreprise (courrier, fichiers, etc.)

Assurer la liaison avec le technicien A/C et les électriciens pour s'assurer que le bureau est correctement équipé

Configurer, surveiller et mettre à jour la sécurité informatique et les pare-feux

Aider aux réunions de vente, aux présentations et aux expositions selon les besoins en achetant et en mettant en œuvre des technologies pour les conférences audiovisuelles

Compléter les travaux dans les délais prévus

Avoir un minimum d'absentéisme et être ponctuel

Maintenir un bon entretien du lieu de travail

Remplir d'autres tâches assignées




COMPÉTENCES



Connaissance de Microsoft Active Directory et de l'administration Exchange

Bonne connaissance de MAC, OSX et IOS

Compréhension de la configuration des imprimantes laser et zebra

Compréhension de la configuration du scanner RF

Capacité à administrer la configuration DNS

Expérience antérieure avec SAP considérée comme un atout

Diplôme universitaire/collégial

Capacité à déployer des réseaux câblés considéré comme un atout (certification requise)

1 à 3 ans dans un poste comparable




À propos de Medline Canada


Medline Canada est une entreprise pionnière dans le domaine des soins de santé. Elle propose son expertise et une vaste gamme de solutions à tous les établissements de soins. Avec plus de 550 employés, y compris 100 agents de vente et de professionnels cliniques et plus de 8 centres de distribution partout au pays, Medline Canada est fière de pouvoir servir tout le marché des soins de santé.


Notre engagement en matière de diversité et d’inclusion


Medline Canada est engagée envers la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous encourageons les candidatures des membres des groupes historiquement désavantagés et marginalisés, y compris les Premières Nations, les Métis, les Inuits, les peuples autochtones de l’Amérique du Nord, les personnes racialisées/de couleur ainsi que les personnes s’identifiant comme étant une femme, handicapée ou un membre de la communauté LGBTQ+.


Notre engagement envers l’accessibilité


Medline Canada est engagée envers les principes de l’AODA (Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act). Nous fournissons tous les efforts possibles dans nos processus de recrutement, d’évaluation et de sélection afin de favoriser l’accessibilité au travail et de fournir les mesures d’adaptation nécessaires aux candidats avec des invalidités. Si vous souhaitez des mesures d’adaptation à tout moment durant le processus de candidature et d’embauche, écrivez à l’adresse HRCanada@medline.com.

Nous incitons tous les candidats qualifiés à soumettre leur candidature. Nous accordons toutefois la priorité aux citoyens et aux résidents permanents canadiens.


Primary Location


CA-QC-Terrebonne

Account manager




About the job.


 We’re looking for the type of person that thrives on saving the day. You know the one. The superhero type. The one that runs towards danger while others are running away.







Oh, hey.


 Does the idea of trying to control the unique chaos of an agency filled with smart, passionate and admittedly strange people get you a bit excited? If you answered yes and are a proud to be a control freak, we should talk. 







The gig.


 Account manager. We’re looking for a Account manager to join our team but not just any Account manager. We need the really special kind.






You’re going to spend part of your day working directly with 3-5 of our clients and part of your day leading a team of coordinators and creatives – creative coordinators and uncoordinated creatives (we’re really hoping our creatives don’t read this).






The deets. Do the kids still say “deets?” Honestly, we’re not sure. We got lost at “on fleek.” Anyways, let’s get serious with a serious-looking list of what we’re hoping you have:







Laugh (or cry and laugh) at chaos:
 A lot happens in a typical agency day and it all seemingly happens at once. Whatever you thought busy and hectic was….double it. You need to be someone who thrives in chaos and can clearly see the path out.







We may be looking for (another) unicorn: 
In another life, you were probably a creative director. You can pitch and have a strong creative eye. You feel comfortable in client meetings on your own and can see the big picture. You can guide clients through initial strategic thinking, talk social and get pretty pumped about kerning. You're probably a bit of a generalist.







Experience. You've got some: 
You're going to be working directly with some pretty big, global brands. It's important for you you to understand how these organizations work and be able to navigate your way through. You're probably hanging out at another agency, looking for a new challenge or client-side yearning for some chaos. You most likely have somewhere in the 5-8 year range of experience.







Your average day: 
You'll get an email from a client with a new project. You'll whip up a brief and book an initial discovery meeting right before you jump into into an already booked discovery meeting with another client. In that meeting, you will take the lead, asking questions to better understand the need while providing some initial strategic direction.






You'll check in with your team on some outstanding items, review design before packaging it up and sending it off to a client. You then find yourself in a meeting where you'll be leading a pitch on a new campaign and then off to pull together a budget for a video. You'll wrap the day with a team meeting before grabbing a bite with a client.






Rinse and repeat but different, every day.







Customer focused: 
Human-centered design thinking is at the base of everything we do and you’re able to understand our customer’s perspective. Their happiness is paramount in everything you do and you get that. You're driven by making people happy - you may even be a little driven by making sure you never let people down.







Team leader:
 You were unanimously voted project lead in every elementary, junior high, high school and university project. You have the ability to rally the team and speak multiple languages: client, project team, creative. 







Attention to details:
 You love the details. You sweat the details and you pick up on everything that everyone else missed. Your friends and family are probably annoyed by it (but we’ll love it).







Problem solver:
 “I don’t know” is not in your vocabulary… but “I can figure it out” definitely is! Problem solving and a willingness to figure things out with minimal direction is essential. You’re autonomous, yet highly communicative. You get it done and keep everyone in the loop while you do.







One more time:
 The one above this is pretty important, so we wanted to say it again. We need the kind of person who can take something and own it; someone who wants to be involved in everything and has the dedication to follow through.







Agile:
 We’re a growing company and we’ll be honest…we don’t always have our stuff together. We’re “building the plane while we fly”, so to speak. You’ll need to be someone that can embrace this chaos on top of the typical agency chaos.







Organized: 
You love Gantt charts, scheduling and probably have a case just for your highlighters (iykyk). You've got to love autonomy and have the ability to keep yourself organized. 







Tech geek(ish):
 You get technology and are comfortable is using because, well, we use it all the time.

job_title: Recognition & Engagement Specialist, Stewardship, Office of Advancement Services
industries: Higher Education, Research Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Position Overview



The 
Department of Stewardship 
in the 
Office of Advancement Services
 is currently seeking a Full-time Regular 
Recognition & Engagement Specialist
.

The University of Calgary is Canada's leading next-generation university: a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation's most enterprising city, the University is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada's top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines.

The Recognition Specialist will embrace achievement of these goals as they apply to celebrating our donors through excellent stewardship and recognition. Reporting to the Director, Stewardship, the successful candidate will contribute to meaningful communications, stewardship and recognition that celebrates new and existing donors; informs and educates future donors; and creates consistency with how we engage UCalgary stakeholders as it relates to philanthropy.

The goal of the Recognition Specialist is to ensure that UCalgary remains relevant and competitive in all aspects of donor recognition and mitigates reputational risk to the institution through rigorous counsel and governance regarding policy and process adherence. This will be achieved through benchmarking, specialized industry awareness, networking with internal and external peer organizations and implementing a collaborative approach to all work. Strong processes and policies with supporting tools and templates are paramount to the success of our day-to-day operations, which help to maintain meaningful, long lasting relationships that can be leveraged in the future to support a sustainable fundraising program.

There is a high volume of work requiring strong communication, project management, leadership, consultation, relationship building, facilitation, negotiation and client service skills. The position deals with complex issues, and requires sound judgment and decision-making, and the ability to manage fluid expectations, projects, shifting priorities and deadlines with minimal supervision. The position will work with all levels of institutional leadership and will serve as a mentor to others, providing best-practices authority on institutional naming, signage and recognition. Decisions made by this position will have an impact university wide, stakeholders who are donors and prospective donors, as well as on key external partners (e.g. foundations, corporations, individuals). The impact of error and stress levels are high, and evening and weekend hours are sometimes required.

A strong understanding of the University's mission, values and plans is key, as work often affects internal and external stakeholders including donors, fundraisers, recipient units of gifts. Commitment to accuracy of work and specialized knowledge is critical.

This position is critical to helping realize the Office of Advancement's strategic vision by developing and managing a comprehensive donor recognition program (primarily focused on institutional naming and signage) by administering strategy, structure, priorities, policies and procedures for faculty and staff on campus. The Specialist administers the institution's Philanthropic Naming Policy and Operating Standards and conducts the workflow required for annual review of the policy. This role will govern all philanthropic namings (past and future) while directly working with the Director of Operations to generate naming request submissions and Briefing Notes for Action for the Executive Leadership Team and the Board of Governors' approval. The Specialist will ensure recognition opportunities are within scope and alignment with the naming policy and with donor gift agreements, mitigating reputational risk and discrepancies in standard practices at the University.

The Specialist's accountability within the unit has two fundamental goals:


Recognition celebrates and promotes the gifts made to the institution, the donors who have made them, and the impact that they will make or have made as a result. Recognition activities are tied to donor strategy, planned and executed in ways that are meaningful, personal and timely for the donor and strategically support the UCalgary Giving mandate. The Specialist will need to manage and execute strategy and positioning of recognition policies, standards, processes and procedures across campus. Recognition practices will include institutional naming and signage.

Engaging current donors to UCalgary through opportunities and activities that are relevant to stewardship of their relationships with UCalgary. Working closely with faculty-based Advancement staff, the Specialist will be mandated to create a meaningful and streamlined strategy for recognition practices to increase the quality of touch points with current donors.

Leads collaborative meetings with key business units (Campus Architecture, Gift Compliance, Faculty Advancement staff, Communications, etc) to plan effective tactics as part of an overall plan to maintain an excellent donor recognition program.




Position Description




Summary of Key Responsibilities
 (job functions include but are not limited to):


Plan and oversee the short- and long-term components of an integrated donor recognition program that improves accountability and transparency to donors.

Provides strategic and proactive leadership in planning, developing, implementing and continuously improving plans, tools, structures, priorities, policies, procedures and information management relating to the institutional recognition practices across campus. This includes fulfilling donor naming opportunities based on donor gift agreements and ensuring proper follow up and adherence with the Philanthropic Naming Policy.

In partnership with the Director, Stewardship, oversees, influences, supports and complements faculty- and unit-based donor relations programs for a seamless, integrated donor experience.

Responsible for the creation and implementation of recognition plans at both the central and faculty levels and ensuring staff follow best practices and standards. Develop and maintain methods of tracking and reporting on institutional recognition practices using the BBCRM database and Tableau to advance overall recognition touch points.

Administers the effectiveness of policies, procedures and tools with respect to donor recognition, philanthropic naming and institutional signage throughout campus. This includes managing the process for expired namings, governing all future namings with the appropriate stakeholders, conducting an inventory of present-day naming opportunities on campus, leading an audit of all existing institutional namings and liaising with Campus Architecture regarding standardized and relevant donor signage opportunities.

Provide leadership, management and coaching to Advancement staff, with accountabilities for donor recognition, naming and signage.

Train faculty and staff on the Philanthropic Naming Policy and Operating Standards and institutional recognition program and engage them in new processes to enhance the long-term effectiveness of donor relationships.




Qualifications / Requirements




University degree in a related field or a minimum of three years of related experience in fundraising, stewardship and donor recognition and/or communications, in combination with project management.

Understanding of the donor cycle and the importance of communications, recognition and stewardship to that cycle is essential.

Experience with BBCRM is an asset.

Project management experience is essential.

Proven organizational abilities and strong interpersonal skills and must be an innovative thinker with high levels of initiative, energy and enthusiasm.

Ability to work both independently and as part of a team; demonstrates integrity and a strong sense of professional ethics and must be able to work effectively in a large, complex, dynamic and sophisticated organization.

Possess experience with creating and sustaining knowledge management strategies, and policies and procedures. You understand and demonstrate commitment to adhere to both legal privacy requirements and ethical standards.



Application Deadline:
 March 15, 2022


We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.




Additional Information



This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the 

Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase II

.

To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our 
Management and Staff Careers website
.

The University strongly recommends all faculty and staff are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.



About The University Of Calgary



The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university - a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit

.

description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


YOU make a difference

If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors.

Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling.

The Opportunity

Ready to make a difference in the lives of seniors? We’re looking for an experienced Licensed Practical Nurse to join our team of dedicated health professionals. Reporting to the Director of Care, you will play a key role in our patient-centred, goal-directed approach to care. From evaluating clinical care plans to administering medication and other treatment, your role is as important as it is fulfilling.



A Typical Day




 Fostering relationships with residents and families to ensure plan of care is resident focused and carried out;

 Evaluating a resident’s plan of care, ensuring the assessment is up to date and accurately documented;

 Processing and administering medication in accordance with regulatory requirements;

 Collaborating with and advising Health Care Aides and staff on best practices related to the delivery of our health-care programs and policies;

 Supporting the arrival, transfer or departure of residents;

 Responding to emerging health conditions and medical emergencies, including the delivery of first-aid care.


What YOU bring


 Current registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in your province of work

 Experience working with seniors and alongside Health Care Aides, as well as education tied to gerontology, rehabilitation and long-term care

 Current basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification

 Proficient assessment, documentation and communication skills

 Proficiency with technology including: Electronic Health Records, Electronic Medication Administration Records, Online Applications

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC)


What we offer


 Technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Better work life balance

 Vision to support Person Centered Care


Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow.

Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!


Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

job_title: Senior Business & Commercial Development Manager - Carlsberg Canada
industries: Manufacturing
description:
Posting Date



07-Mar-2022


Location:


GTA (Greater Toronto Area), CA



Entity / Company



Carlsberg Export & License (CE&L)

Senior Business & Commercial Development Manager - Carlsberg Canada

Company Background

Carlsberg Canada Inc. is the Canadian Division of Carlsberg Breweries A/S which is the World’s 3rd largest brewer and one of the fastest growing brewers in the World. With over 100 beer brands in our portfolio Carlsberg sells beer in over 140 countries world-wide while producing beer under license in over 40 countries.

Role overview

As a dynamic challenger Carlsberg Canada has a strong growth ambition towards 2027 with a combination of own sales forces and strategic partnerships across our key provinces Ontario, Quebec, B.C, and Alberta. The Senior Business & Commercial Development Manager will work centrally across all our provinces to lead priority business and commercial development projects from idea to execution, while simultaneously guiding our annual strategic planning cycle. This is the opportunity to apply your unique analytical mind set and personal drive to deliver significant contribution in a national role. It is a new role and given the strategic importance it will report to the Managing Director of CCI and be a part of the CCI Management Team.

What you’ll be doing

You will (1) lead several high priority business development projects and (2) guide the annual strategic planning and performance cycle. Both tasks will be performed with support from our functional teams in Carlsberg Canada and the Global Carlsberg HQ in Denmark, but you will be responsible for driving these.


 Our business development projects are ambitious initiatives centered on selected growth drivers and anchored in our Sail 2027 strategy. Examples:


Optimizing our Sourcing and Supply chain (incl. minimizing damages, SKU’s optimization etc.)

Development and implementation of commercial initiatives like BPPC, VM, FIT across the provinces

Route-to-market development & step-change

Your role is to drive the projects and maintain the overview, provide steady guidance on team inputs (e.g., from Sales, Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain, Legal, more), identify risks and opportunities and synthesize information into actionable recommendations for relevant stakeholders and executive decision-makers.


 Given your position in the central organization, you will also be relied upon to facilitate and guide our annual strategic planning and performance cycle. This means performing key commercial analyses and developing presentation content for company-wide performance reviews, budgets and 3-year strategies. This work is performed in close collaboration with your colleagues in Finance, Marketing, Sales, HR and Supply Chain.


What we’re looking for

You have a master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Strategy, Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain) and have minimum 3-5 years in a similar role, ideally with previous exposure to the Beverage or Consumer Packaged Goods industry.


You possess the following traits and are energized by them:


Striving to maintain robust mindset in the face of business challenges

Self-driven, action-oriented

Listening, curious, able to crowd-source answers

Communicating effectively towards stakeholders at all levels



Furthermore, y Ou Have Proven Success In



Managing strategic projects from idea to execution

Business case development

Implementation of business and commercial initiatives

Presentations and written memos to Executive Management

Fluency in English; French is an asset. The position will be based at our main office located in Oakville, Ontario. Some travel is to be expected.

What you can expect


We’re asking for a lot, but you’ll be well-rewarded with:



Continuous learning:
 Support from mentors and formal training programs

The potential to develop your career, also internationally

A truly purpose-driven company with an ambitious strategy

An informal and social work culture with passionate colleagues

Interested?

Apply through the link. Please notice that this is the only way we accept applications. For questions about the position please contact Managing Director Carlsberg Canada, Anders Rud Jørgensen at ******** . Deadline for applying is 14th of March . We read applications continuously, and vacancies may be filled sooner than the deadline, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.

We look forward to receiving your application.


Carlsberg Group:
 Brewing for a better today and tomorrow

F or us success has always been in the diverse mix of our people, our beers and our brands. At Carlsberg, we want to recruit and develop people with a global mindset, cultural understanding, and international experience to ensure that our organization stays agile, inclusive and prepared for future growth. Only by acknowledging and harvesting from different perspectives and experiences, will we gain competitive advantage and leverage the effect of diversity for business growth. Carlsberg aims to create equal access to opportunity regardless of social identity, and we encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law.

description:
Description




Our bottom line is different.


There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making 
it
 possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.

Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.

Job Number: REQ3567

Location: Edmonton or Calgary

Apply by: March 14

Paygrade: K

Leader: Director, CFO Business Process & Architecture



Primary Accountabilities




Process Improvement Specialist - You will be responsible for reviewing business processes to identify potential gaps, redundancies, and opportunities to automate as well as make recommendations for process improvements that support business strategies, optimize performance, and improve the user experience. Using the appropriate Process Improvement methodology for the initiative, you will be responsible for leading all phases of the business improvement cycle - which includes mapping current state, define gaps/challenges, analyze what needs to change, work with relevant subject matter experts to redesign the change and create and execute the change management plan to ensure process adoption, implement, and measure.

Lead and Execute Initiatives - For small and medium sized initiatives you will be accountable for leading all phases of the initiative and the successful adoption of the solution. This includes participating in and/or leading discovery sessions, documenting current state, measuring baseline, and defining project measurables. Moving into the solution refinement phase, you would define and evaluate solutions, present recommendations, and create the initiative execution plan. Moving into the execution and adoption phases, you would create the change management plan (communication, training, documentation), build the roll-out strategy, implement the solution, provide post-Implementation support, and measure benefits against baseline. For large, technology based projects, you will play a key role in the project but resourcing will be commensurate with the resourcing needs of the project, such as a dedicated project manager, developers, and third party resources.

Catalyst for Change - Challenge everything and act as a change champion for advancing the mindset and skills of the future within the areas you support. 

Mentorship - You will act as a mentor and support resource to the Business Analyst. 




Requirements




Business Analyst certification. 

Lean or Six Sigma certification with applicable experience. 

7+ years of experience in Business Analyst roles. 

Direct experience in Agile and project/program management. 

Proficient knowledge in Google Suite and other analytical/statistical (ex. Tableau, JIRA, ARIS, Google App Script).

Strong critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, to recognize and resolve complex issues and devise creative solutions.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to navigate challenging personalities and influence senior leaders.

Ability to build and maintain relationships with team members. 

Knowledge in SQL and database functionality. 

Demonstrated interest in new technologies such as AI and Automation.




Nice To Haves




Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field. 

Proficiency with SAP systems. 

Previous Banking Experience.

Familiarity with Accounting principles. 


At ATB, we know that highly talented people can readily transfer their skills. If you believe your skills and experience are transferable, please consider putting your name in the running.



Benefits




Be great. Be you. Believe.


We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.


What happens next?


Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.

ATB Financial team members are required to disclose their COVID vaccination status and provide proof of vaccination or complete COVID rapid testing as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety. We thank all candidates in advance for their understanding.


Stay in touch!


ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 16 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: GreenChef, EveryPlate, Chef's Plate, Factor, and Youfoodz.



About The Role



We are looking for a full-time Operational Excellence Manager at our Abbotsford facility reporting to the Director of Production.



You Will




Identify opportunities and gaps in processes; align resources to these priorities; ensure appropriate charters and quality improvement methodologies, tools, and techniques are being used to promote improvements; continue to advocate for future operational improvements by partnering with and challenging the business and leadership in new ideas.

Promote OpEx capability development programs and partner with functional leaders to implement performance improvement projects in the facility.

Develop a self-sustaining program by identifying and engaging employees to lead continuous improvement efforts.

Oversee implementation of HF Operations Strategic projects including Continuous Improvement, Change Management, cost optimization, and Operational Excellence Training.

Lead large-scale improvement projects within operations or across facilities and coordinate these programs with the project teams.

Ensure that the organization adopts practices promoting continuous improvement to improve morale, quality, delivery, and cost.

Communicate best practices and learning across the organization.

Lead risk identification and risk-mitigating planning

Organize project post-mortems with all partners and identify critical areas for process improvements

Influence a large team of indirect reports including associates, managers, and leaders across HelloFresh




You Have




5+ years of project management experience in a Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain experience, targeted towards Continuous Improvement implementation

preferably with a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Engineering, Business or a related field

Strong understanding of OHS and Food Safety and its application in a warehouse and production environment

An authentic leader, who’s able to build strong relationships, clearly communicate and motivate, and drive accountability at all levels

An effective collaborator, who empowers and enables others to share ideas, raises awareness, gets buy-in, and delivers fast and well-rounded solutions to complex problems

A strong analytical problem solver that identifies and simplifies complex issues and drives rapid, focused, and data-driven solutions

Energy, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude. Used to working in a high pressure, fast-paced, and constantly changing environment

Drive and self-motivation. We seek a leader who competes to win and have the burning desire to make a meaningful difference in our business and the lives of our employees

Strong understanding of manufacturing and warehouse systems and controls

Professional certifications and/or licenses with Lean Six Sigma preferred

Willingness to travel up to 15% of the time




What You’ll Get




Competitive salary and company benefits

75% discount on HelloFresh boxes

High level of responsibility from day one

The opportunity to rapidly advance your career

Working with a fun, ambitious and supportive team


If this sounds like you, please click the "Apply Now" button. If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, but you'd like to know more about joining the HelloFresh team, please visit our Jobs page to view our other vacancies. We'd love to hear from you!



About HelloFresh



We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

description:
Hi, I’m Laura from JENNY BIRD. I’m currently the Vice President of Brand Marketing and E-commerce and we’re looking for a Loyalty & Retention Marketing Manager to join our growing team. I started with JB in June of 2019 in a part-time capacity and I quickly transitioned to a full-time role after being so inspired by the potential of this brand. We have an incredible team of people working here who support one another and I feel so lucky to be a part of that.

In this role, you will be a key support in growing our Email, SMS and loyalty related channels. You’ll work directly with myself (Laura) and our Brand Marketing Manager to develop and execute strategies aimed at retaining and rewarding our customers. As an essential part of our Marketing team, you will be responsible for analyzing cohorts, running frequent A/B tests to improve LTV, identifying opportunities for rewarding loyalty as well as other lifecycle initiatives.

The Opportunity:


Run the planning, management and deployment of our email and SMS channels. 

Conduct customer research to understand retention behaviour and create more touchpoints for it. 

Run A/B tests across lifecycle channels to increase LTV and 2nd purchase rate.

Research, design and launch our loyalty program.

Conduct regular audits of our automated flows and work closely with our Editorial Director and Creative Team to make improvements to these. 

Ensure campaign calendar is adequately supported with email and SMS content to convert leads into customers, and grow repeat purchase rates.

Monitor, analyze, and report on all email and SMS channel KPI's.

Constantly improving customer segmentation through regular testing to provide our customers with the most personalized experience possible.

Work cross-functionally, especially with our Operations and Customer Experience team to optimize the customer experience (pre and post-purchase).

Stay on the cutting edge of email, SMS, and retention in order to pitch, A/B test, and roll out ways to optimize and grow our customer base.

Work closely with our Ecommerce team to build regular loyalty touchpoints into our website and forthcoming app. 



What you bring to the table:


Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or relevant field of study.

2-3 years experience in a retention marketing capacity.

Experience with Klaviyo and other email service providers.

Proficient with Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets.

Experience in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio.

Exceptional interpersonal skills; the ability to communicate effectively at all levels throughout the organization.

You are a strategic thinker who makes data-informed decisions.

You use marketing analytic tools to report on performance and craft insights.

You’re a collaborative team player who can brainstorm with others.

You’re flexible and can adapt to changing priorities on the go.



Perks at Jenny Bird:


3-weeks vacation + 4 floating days + Summer Fridays (we close the office early at 1pm!)

A comprehensive benefits program + health care spending account

Parental leave top-up

Professional development budget to use towards courses and/or certificates 

Perks on JENNY BIRD products!



Location:


We have flexible working arrangements for the team. Currently, our team is working remotely 80% of the time and have been encouraged to visit the office 1 day a week.

Our office is located at Queen and Spadina.



JENNY BIRD does not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Aurea Software. Have you got what it takes?

Are you detail-obsessed and enjoy getting your hands dirty doing the work? You will rock at this role! Here you will learn constantly from a consistent stream of challenging and different projects.

Are you motivated by challenging puzzles and are a driven and creative problem solver?

At Aurea, the Solutions and Services teams leverage multiple Aurea products to solve the complex business problems applicable to a number of customers. These solutions combine our products in new and unique ways, creating seamless software solutions that unlock tremendous business value for our customers. The solutions are not developed or deployed for one-off customers as developed in a typical consulting organization. Instead, it's similar to a software product being delivered to a large customer base.

Unlike a traditional Architect who works on a specific product and on a specific technology, successful candidates in this role will be working on building standard solutions using multiple products for a large customer base. This role does not require expertise in only one language. Instead, it requires the ability to pick up new technologies and ramp up on multiple product frameworks.



What You Will Be Doing




Work with the solution director translates the business use case into the solution storyboard 

Architect and design the technical solution (preparing a technical spec and c4 architecture models)

Guide/mentor developers on implementation and deliver the GA releases to all customers.




What You Won’t Be Doing




You are not involved in Core Product Engineering, will not be working on a specific product and specific technology.

You will not build products from scratch. It is about leveraging existing frameworks and assembling/integrating multiple products to solve a business use-case.




Senior Software Architect Key Responsibilities




You will make business decisions while detailing a storyboard that captures the business value, use case, and user stories/personas delivered by a solution.

You will make architecture decisions that efficiently integrate multiple Aurea products using the Aurea Integration Hub to bring life to the storyboard.

You will make design decisions that strike a balance between reliable, secure, scalable architecture vs the urgency of the business need. Eg. how to build an MVP and evolve it into a fully scalable solution.

You will estimate and derive a WBS while the low-level specifications are still worked upon.




Basic Requirements




great self-learner who has learned new technologies by themself e.g. AWS architecture, Docker, Kubernetes, etc

expert coder in one of the technology stacks - Java, JavaScript, C#,

exposure to AWS architecture, Docker, Kubernetes.




Nice-to-have Requirements




UX / UI - Usability experience and design thinking.

Product management and product ownership exposure

Agile Delivery Methodologies.




About Aurea Software



Aurea was founded with the singular vision of helping businesses succeed in today’s complex digital landscape. To achieve that goal, we do things differently. Our customers enjoy access to every product in our portfolio - all of which are cloud-based, enterprise-scale, and easy to use - with one simple subscription. We focus on relationships instead of transactions. And our unique AureaOne operating model and acquisition strategy ensure that our portfolio continues to grow, so we can continue to provide competitive advantage and differentiated results for our customers no matter what the future holds.

Aurea was an early adopter of remote work. In fact, our entire team of nearly 2,000 people and growing operates in a fully-remote work model.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Posting:


The Role and the Company

We are Lehigh Hanson. Our products build cities and towns, including stadiums that hold thousands of fans, and bridges that support millions of vehicles. We have thousands of employees across hundreds of locations in the U.S. and Canada, making us North America’s leading supplier of cement, aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt, and related construction materials.

We might be a big company, but we appreciate and encourage our people to share their ideas and help shape our future. With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. We’re a tight-knit team. While we strive to be the best, we do it with an attitude that is humble, accessible and down-to-earth. We don’t ask you to “fit in” to our culture. We invite you to add to it.

Reporting to the Director, Sustainable Resource Development, the 
Environment Manager
 is responsible for assisting with the environmental compliance and performance requirements at all assigned facilities in British Columbia. This role works with multiple levels of management to support all environmental permitting, due diligence assessments, reporting, and all required compliance activities for Lehigh Hanson’s construction materials business, including sand, gravel, and hard rock mines, concrete ready-mix plants, and asphalt plants. This position is ideal for someone who is self-motivated and enjoys problem solving and collaborating in a team setting.

What you’ll get to do:


Lead operational permitting applications, environmental impact assessments, stakeholder and Public open houses, and First Nations consultation required to develop new aggregate reserves and to establish facilities for the material businesses.

Prepare and coordinate all environmental permits, reports, and related requirements for facilities.

Manage the due diligence and environmental assessments for land acquisitions and divestments.

Interpret impacts to business lines from current and emerging environmental regulatory requirements at all levels including Federal, Provincial, County, Municipality, City, etc.

Ensure continuous improvement of environmental systems, programs, and strategies and promote environmental best practices at all facilities.

In collaboration with Corporate and Operational management, ensure standards, programs, and initiatives are implemented, integrated, and effective.

Collect applicable environmental compliance data and prepare required reports.

Track and report all corporate-required metrics in support of HeidelbergCement 2030 Sustainability Goals.

Identify environmental issues that require capital expenditure, assist in the preparation of requests for capital approvals, and lead the implementation of the chosen solution.

Ensure compliance requirements are met through organizational and procedural measures including implementation of Corporate guidelines, completion of required training, and monitoring compliance.

Provide guidance and training to all levels of the organization to ensure all employees act in an environmentally responsible manner and carry out their activities in compliance with all applicable environmental regulations and legislation.

Complete site inspections and audits providing recommendations and ensuring follow-up on corrective actions.



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree or combination of training and experience in Environmental Management or another related field

Field experience in industrial settings is an asset.

Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting.

Demonstrated knowledge of applicable legislation and regulations.

Effective problem solving and written/oral communication skills

Experience with negotiating and bringing stakeholders together to stimulate positive change and build strong relationships.

Capable of using and implementing online management and reporting systems.

Ability to travel throughout BC as needed



What we have to offer:


Competitive compensation package and paid time off vacation policy, benefits, and pension plan

Opportunities for training, development, career growth within a global organization

A diverse, inclusive, supportive, and innovative work environment with best in-class people



Work Environment:


Role operates in an office and manufacturing environment with moving mechanical equipment, inclement weather, heat, humidity, elevated noise levels, and dusty conditions.

Our pre-employment process includes: reference checks, a medical including drug & alcohol testing, and a criminal record and drivers abstract check may be required.

 We are Canada Life 


Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Be your best at Canada Life.

We are looking for an 
Account Manager, Group Benefits. 


Reporting to the Sales Director, the Account Manager will be responsible for the maintenance of productive relationships with Benefits Advisors and group policy holders, acquisition of new business, and management of accounts of an in‑force business portfolio. The successful candidate will work with a team to reach or exceed the objectives–sales, profitability, renewal, and persistency targets–set by management. The management of those targets requires great decision‑making ability, initiative, and creativity within a team.



What We Offer




 A dynamic work environment and competitive compensation package 

 The opportunity to work together with business partners and client companies 

 A flexible and stimulating work environment focused on collaboration 

 The opportunity to be part of a winning team 




What You Will Do




 Work together with Benefit Advisors to review quote specifications for potential clients, and write and present proposals to Advisors or potential clients 

 Perform all duties related to the management of accounts assigned, in particular financial duties such as annual account renewal 

 Ability to solve problems related to unusual or delicate claims and address financial matters for which guidelines are not available or act in cases where a decision must be taken after consultation with Field Management 

 Resourceful to develop and maintain relationships with Benefit Advisors and be attentive to their needs, so that they are excited to do business with Canada Life 




What You Will Bring




 Undergraduate diploma or equivalent 

 Minimum of five (5) years of experience in the field of group insurance and thorough knowledge of group life insurance, healthcare insurance, disability insurance, and underwriting 

 Excellent communication skills, both spoken and written with an enthusiasm for doing presentations 

 Excellent mathematical skills 

 Ability to act quickly and put forward innovative solutions 

 Ability to work in a fast‑evolving environment and adapt to growth and change 

 Strong sales and interpersonal skills as well as motivation to achieve business objectives 

 Knowledge of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 

 Valid driver’s license and vehicle, given the travel needs 

 Designation of C.A.A.S. [certified group benefits advisor], GBA (Group Benefits Associate), or CEBS (Certified Employee Benefits Specialist) is a significant asset 



 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today 



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers! 


Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee  has the opportunity to  reach their potential.


 Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted
