description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.

At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.



About The Role



We’re looking for a 

Administrative Assistant 

to join our growing team!

We are searching for an experienced Executive Assistant reporting to an IT Director to support the management team at the Director level. This role requires a professional who is collaborative, detail oriented and has the ability to multi-task.

Providing superior support, you will be responsible for a wide range of business administration and general support of a highly confidential nature. You will bring a high level of tact and integrity due to the nature of the work performed, the frequency of internal and external contacts and exposure to confidential information.

Liaising with all functional areas on various business matters, you will implement superior organization and multitasking abilities while ensuring a strong understanding of the organizational structures.



Workplace:

 Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa) or Anjou (7101 Jean-Talon Est)



What You’ll Do Here




Process the creation and reception of PO for employees and SOW.

Oversee the fees for contractual and SOW resources.

Support the arrivals and departure of employees and contractors.

Manage equipment returns and associated costs.

Manage access requests for employees and contractors.

Manage distribution lists for various groups.

Process expense reports for Directors if necessary.

Support Directors and Managers for various purchases (ex : trainings for employees, licence renewals, etc…)

Support with the floor plans and act as a main point of contact with the building resources

Support with meeting room reservations.

Manage the vacation balance for the team.

Plan meetings for the group CPL and claims

Provide support with catering orders for meetings and events.

Support with travel planning arrangements when necessary.

Provide support with translation and editing documents.

Participate in special projects as they arise.




Qualifications




What you bring to the table:



Post-secondary education in a related field.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in a professional work environment as an Administrative Assistant or Project Coordinator.

Fluent bilingualism in English and French is an asset

Superior organization skills and a demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Outstanding interpersonal skills, tact and a proven ability to achieve goals.

Excellent listening and communication skills and the ability to tactfully foster strong working relationships.

Advanced skills in MS Office Suite. Experience with Lotus Notes preferred.

Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.



Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:



An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career



Flexible Work Arrangements


Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. Once it’s safe to do so, we will move to a hybrid approach which will give everyone the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. Schedules will be determined in partnership between individuals, managers, and the team.

Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

description:
Description




Revera is a leading provider of seniors’ accommodation, care and services; built on a more than 50-year history of helping seniors live life to the fullest. We reward excellence and provide exciting opportunities to contribute, grow and advance. Whether you're looking for full-time or part-time employment, a student placement, or a volunteer position, Revera offers many rewarding opportunities. Explore what we have to offer and see how you can succeed



YOU make a difference If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors. Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling. The Opportunity Ready to make a difference in someone’s life? As a Personal Support Worker, you will help us deliver the person-centred care Revera is renowned for. Reporting to the Director of Care, you will ensure the proper delivery of our services, including assisting with personal care, meal service and hygiene, to observing and reporting changes in physical or mental health and well-being. Whether social, emotional, psychological or physical, if it concerns our residents, it concerns YOU! A typical day might include:


 Ensuring each resident receives care tailored to their needs, as determined by your supervisor;

 Fostering relationships with residents and families;

 Providing support and professional insights for both residents and their families;

 Helping residents meet their daily care needs and longer-term goals;

 Responding to residents’ questions and concerns with HEART: Hear, Empathize, Acknowledge, Respond, Thank. What YOU bring

 Graduate of Personal Support Worker program (or provincial equivalent certificate program with completion of required theory and practicum hours)

 Strong oral communication, as well as time-management skills

 Tech savvy – having the ability to complete online documentation via iPhone/iPad

 Experience providing personal-care duties, including providing tasks such as lifting and transferring clients

 Current Basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification recommended

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC) What we offer

 Technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Better work life balance

 Vision to support Person Centered Care Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow. Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!




Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


YOU make a difference If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors. Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling. The Opportunity Are YOU ready to enrich lives? We are looking for an experienced Registered Nurse to join our team. Reporting to the Director of Care, your expertise and careful administration of resident care will help ensure we retain our reputation for delivering the best in person-centred care for seniors across Canada. This role includes:


 Fostering relationships with residents and families to ensure plan of care is resident focused and carried out;

 Managing, evaluating, and facilitating residents’ plan of care through collaboration with the resident, family members and the interdisciplinary team;

 Participate in residents’ care conferences;

 Collaborating with the Director of Care in facilitating resident move-in and transfers;

 Ensure safe medication administration according to regulatory requirements and Revera’s policies and procedures, including delegating medical administration to Unregulated Care Providers such as Personal Support Workers or Health Care Aides;

 Complete Clinical Assessments that ensure appropriate resident care;

 Liaise with interdisciplinary team and external care providers to facilitate best plan of care for each resident;

 Lead and support Personal Support Workers and Health Care Aides in your home area to maximize resident care. What YOU bring

 Current registration as a Registered Nurse in applicable Province

 Education and experience in gerontology, rehabilitation, community/complex/long term care an asset

 Experience working with seniors and unregulated care providers

 Strong assessment, documentation, communication and critical thinking skills

 Strong written, oral and time-management skills, including demonstrated experience delegating tasks to Personal Support Workers / Health Care Aides

 Proficiency with Technology including: Electronic Health Records, Electronic Medication Administration Records, Online Applications

 Current Basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC) What we offer

 Support from your Regional and National teams

 State-of-the-art technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Exceptional work/life balance Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow. Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!



Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Responsibilities




Design infrastructure and Earthworks projects using 3D modeling software

Draft civil drawings using Microstation, Civil 3D and/or Inroads

Cut and fill balances, along with quantity take-offs

Prepare drawings, models, and related calculations

Provide mentorship and guidance to designers/drafters

Prepare written reports

Optimization of civil infrastructure

Complete peer reviews




What You Will Bring




Technical and Industry Experience



10 years of related design experience with a mine or equivalent

Experience using Microstation

Experience using Civil 3D Modelling software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, InRoads)

Excellent English written and verbal communication skills

Candidates must bring strong and effective leadership skills to this role and be capable of managing a team within a major project.




Education – Qualifications, Accreditation, Training




Technical school diploma is preferred, but equivalent experience will also be considered;





What we offer you





Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.




If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

description:
Are you someone who enjoys helping others and building connections to make everyone feel special and to create a sense of belonging? If yes, then we want YOU to be part of our Fairmont Royal York family.

Every day you will be responsible for engaging with our guests, clients and colleagues. You will create the essential Toronto experience at the hotel that has been a Canadian icon for over 91 years. You will be given the responsibility to ensure that our guests and colleagues feel WELCOMED, CARED FOR and INCREDIBLE. Being part of the Fairmont Royal York family is more than providing warm and consistent service. As an ambassador of Fairmont Royal York, you will take the initiatives necessary to turn moments into memories by taking the time to understand our guests’ purposes: why are they staying at Fairmont Royal York, what is their length of stay and what are their preferences and passions? Making our guests feel heard and cared for creates an emotional connection to our brand and builds loyalty.

By simply taking the time to get to know the individual you are speaking with, you give yourself the opportunity to anticipate their needs and to turn a moment into a memory. Making our guests feel heard and cared for creates an emotional connection to our brand and ensures loyalty. And this isn’t just for the guests, you will do this with every Fairmont Royal York colleague; after all, We Are One, We Are Family, We Are Fairmont Royal York.



What Is In It For You




Employee Discount Travel Program

Rate of pay: $29.04/hour

Employee Assistance Program (EAP) programs through our Academies

Healthcare plan coverage

Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the globe!

Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21



Reporting to the Director of Security and Emergency Management, what you will be doing:



Ensuring security and safety of all property, guests and employees

Regular floor patrols and safety inspections

Providing excellent guest service

Assisting in the orientation of new staff to hotel's security procedures

Conducting security assessments to determine if hotel guests, employees and assets are properly protected

Correcting and reporting of fire hazards, health and safety hazards

Operating as a member of the Emergency Response Team 

Investigating and reporting on occurrences of accidents, complaints, criminal activity, and crisis situations

Control, staff, and monitor hotel access points 

Responding to all alarms- perimeter doors, panic alarms, etc… 

Handling lost and found in conjunction with the other departments 

Knowledge and application of Municipal, Provincial, and Federal statutes with attention to the Trespass to Property Act

Key control involving departmental audits and maintenance of key records\Maintaining computer records of all actions in a Daily Activity Report

Routinely audit security systems and various other systems 

Other duties as directed by the Director, Security Services and/or Supervisor 




Your Experience And Skills Include




Valid Ontario Security License

Valid First Aid and C.P.R. certificates

Law and Security Diploma or equivalent post-secondary education would be an asset 

Self-motivated individual who is animated and highly energetic with a sense of humour

Experience in security and safety of property and people, preferably in a hotel setting 

Excellent organization skills, written and oral communication skills

Computer knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

Ability to work with and learn security related technologies (e.g. access control systems, CCTV, motion and door alarm, etc...)

Ability to effectively work with others in critical stress or emergency situations (eg fire alarms, first aid, supporting emergency personnel, etc...) 

High level of confidentiality when handling guest information 



Physical Aspects of Position include but are not limited to the following: 



Constant standing and walking throughout shift

Frequent lifting and carrying up to 30 lbs

Constant kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting

Frequent ascending or descending ladders, stairs and ramps




About Fairmont Royal York



For over 91 years, Fairmont Royal York has stood proudly as a Toronto landmark. When the hotel opened in 1929 it was the tallest building in the British Common Wealth and contained 1,048 rooms, a concert hall, library, extensive bakery, radio station and even a hospital. Today, this essential downtown landmark has completed a multi-million dollar transformation, reimagining its lobby, rooms, dining venues, event spaces, and Fairmont Gold – the property’s exclusive hotel within a hotel luxury experience. Another stunning chapter for Fairmont Royal York has begun. To learn more, visit http://thefairmontroyalyork.com/

Note: Must already be legally entitled to work in Canada to be considered for the position.


In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Vaccination Policy.




Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion



We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.


Why work for Accor?


We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo!

Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


YOU make a difference

If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors.

Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling.

The Opportunity

Ready to make a difference in the lives of seniors? We’re looking for an experienced Licensed Practical Nurse to join our team of dedicated health professionals. Reporting to the Director of Care, you will play a key role in our patient-centred, goal-directed approach to care. From evaluating clinical care plans to administering medication and other treatment, your role is as important as it is fulfilling.



A Typical Day




 Fostering relationships with residents and families to ensure plan of care is resident focused and carried out;

 Evaluating a resident’s plan of care, ensuring the assessment is up to date and accurately documented;

 Processing and administering medication in accordance with regulatory requirements;

 Collaborating with and advising Health Care Aides and staff on best practices related to the delivery of our health-care programs and policies;

 Supporting the arrival, transfer or departure of residents;

 Responding to emerging health conditions and medical emergencies, including the delivery of first-aid care.


What YOU bring


 Current registration as a Licensed Practical Nurse in your province of work

 Experience working with seniors and alongside Health Care Aides, as well as education tied to gerontology, rehabilitation and long-term care

 Current basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification

 Proficient assessment, documentation and communication skills

 Proficiency with technology including: Electronic Health Records, Electronic Medication Administration Records, Online Applications

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC)


What we offer


 Technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Better work life balance

 Vision to support Person Centered Care


Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow.

Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!


Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

industries: Retail Gasoline
description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.

We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.


Position Title: Property Manager



Team and Location: Burlington, ON



Position Summary: 


The Property Manager is accountable to pro-actively manage and execute all Property transactions and resolve issues across all divisions for 1,000 to 1,500 retail gas stations, C-Stores, and commercial locations nationwide. The successful candidate will also manage corrective and preventative property maintenance for those locations across the country.


Key Responsibilities:



Manage and oversee all lease activity including initiate, negotiate, track, monitor and update all lease activity (renewals, terminations, notices, cam, issues, etc.) with landlord and tenants and internal stakeholder groups.

Within assigned area, track, monitor, negotiate and initiate all lease activity (renewals, terminations, notices, cam, issues etc.) with landlord and tenants and internal stakeholder groups.

Monitor and quickly alleviate issues with Landlord and Tenants.

Manage property and maintenance costs by taking ownership of the P & L lines directly associated with the monies coming and going from the assigned properties as it relates to landlord, tenant, property costs, and maintenance (maintenance only for non-fuel operating sites and leased space).

Manage operations (with internal and external resources) activities and compliance for all excess properties and non-fuel operating tenants.

Work closely with Manager, Leasing and Properties and the appropriate Operations and or National Real Estate and Development Director to support the strategy of the site and ensure Parkland is fully protected as it relates to property management matters.

Properly execute site closures within site plan timelines.

Ensure operating platform for assigned area is up to date and accurate in addition to completing the appropriate reports on a timely basis. Responsible for updating and monitoring critical dates.

Review of legal agreements to determine critical lease dates and obligations.

Work with Retail and Commercial Finance departments to track and process tenancy lease payments.

Ensure tenants follow all regulations and obligations as outlined in lease agreements.

Work with Stakeholders to provide environmental site testing notifications.

Track, confirm amount due & authorize payment of property taxes prior to deadlines for all Corporate, Retail and Commercial owned and leased sites and liaise with property tax consultants as necessary.

Support and implement systems and programs as required to improve efficiency and customer service.

Assist with the development and implementation of budget plans, identify market opportunities and provide strategies to reduce costs while increasing revenue.

Invoice coding, tracking, and troubleshooting.

Reconcile CAM costs for each expense lease property annually.

Approve CAM reconciliations for tenant leases.

Arrange the appropriate preventative maintenance (for non-fuel operating and leased space) program for each assigned location using approved best practice, legal and environmental guidelines.

Engage and monitor contractors and or internal maintenance department to effectively manage maintenance needs across assigned area.

Support Operations, Real Estate and/or Construction for new or acquired sites within region.

Coordinate the services of external third parties to execute property management where internal services are not possible or feasible.




Qualifications and Skills:



Minimum 5-8 years of experience in a multi-site property management function or similar experience.

Post-secondary degree in business, commerce or related professional Property Management education (Such as Certified Property Manager) or combination of experience and education.

Proficient in understanding and interpreting legal documents.

High energy individual who thrives in a fast paced and dynamic organization.

Expert negotiator who can think outside the box for business solutions.

Excellent problem identification and resolution skills.

Exceptional customer service and communication skills.

Proficient in developing and maintaining internal and external business relationships.

People management and consultant management capability.

Efficient with Microsoft Office.

Able to work in English and in French would be an asset.

Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.

Highly organized with excellent planning and time management abilities.

Knowledge of the following would be considered an asset:


Basic accounting principles

Environmental regulations

Fire code compliance

Competition Act

Any other regulations relating to the task at hand.


Has ability to develop, communicate, and monitor business and governance processes within field of responsibility.




We Offer: 



Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.

Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.

A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.

Flexible medical and dental packages, a Health Care Spending Account, along with a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.

In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.

An employee referral program - earn up to $2000 for your referral.

A focus on healthy living through wellness initiatives and an annual fitness reimbursement program.

Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.

A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.



We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. Please note:


Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.

Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.

Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

industries: Non-profit Organizations, Individual and Family Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Senior Administrative Assistant-Full Time-Toronto, ON

Would you like to work for a not-for-profit organization that is dedicated to maximizing the independence and community participation of people with disabilities across Canada? Would you like to play a role in advocating for inclusion and equity for all people living with disabilities?

March of Dimes Canada (MODC) is a federally registered national charity that offers a wide variety of programs and services to Canadians living with disabilities.Since 1951, starting with the polio epidemic, March of Dimes Canada has been on the forefront of the disability movement. We are focused on a bold vision of enhancing services, financing the vision, building partnerships, and creating an appropriate and sustainable infrastructure. Through our Culture Code we live the values of: 
We Are One Team, We Are Accountable To Ourselves and Each Other, and We Adapt and Grow Together. 
To help realize this vision we are adding a Senior Administrative Assistant Accountant toan exemplary and committed Finance Team.



Profile



The
 Senior Administrative Assistant
 is responsible for the coordination and provision of a high level of administrative support within the Finance and IT departments. The Senior Administrative Assistant will serve as the primary administrative support to the Vice President, Chief Financial Officer as well as, to Director of Finance and departmental Financial Services Managers. She/he will assist with the secretarial support for three board committees, Finance, Risk and Audit and Investment. Consequently, the individual will have access to privileged information and or resources that must treated with confidentiality and or be safeguarded.



Responsibilities



The Senior Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing a wide range of administrative support activities:


Serving as the recording secretary, coordinating, various board committee meetings; including assistance with preparing and packaging any required materials, taking and transcribing minutes; assuring appropriate distribution of minutes including safekeeping of historical documents; and tracking agenda items.

Assistance with formatting/or reviewing memoranda, correspondence, reports, agreements, presentations, forms, and other documents ensuring compliance with the appropriate MODC standard templates and procedures.

Establishing, organizing, and maintaining confidential documents electronically. Distribute incoming correspondence, invoices, etc. within the departments on a timely basis.

Must be able to facilitate submitting invoices for Finance and IT departments ensuring the correct coding, approvals are in place and receiving against the purchase orders in the Financial system etc.

Providing support with time sheet recording and updating employee status forms in HR systems. Performing special project assignments as directed, assisting, and providing backup to other administrative staff in the organization.

Being a vital part of the Administrative Support Group in National Office, which meets to share ideas and identify issues and training needs for support staff.




Qualifications And Experience




University degree and/or college diploma in a related field

Minimum 5 years related administrative support experience in a high-volume, large company environment preferably in a Finance department setting

Experience supporting the senior management level, and board meetings including taking minutes and maintaining highly effective working relationships

Skilled in executive-level verbal and written correspondence

Proven project management skills with the ability to prioritize multiple needs and competing demands to meet deadlines

Experience/aptitude for designing documents in a creative and technically sound manner

Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Adobe Pro

Highly aptitude for learning, retaining, and using computer software

High degree of accuracy, thoroughness, and attention to detail

Ability to take verbal and written direction and follow through to complete assigned tasks

Flexibility to changing demands

Accommodation of board committee meeting timings outside of regular work hours

 click apply

Work will initially be performed remotely from a home office until the Toronto office fully re-opens.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality
description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


YOU make a difference If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors. Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling. The Opportunity Are YOU ready to enrich lives? We are looking for an experienced Registered Nurse to join our team. Reporting to the Director of Care, your expertise and careful administration of resident care will help ensure we retain our reputation for delivering the best in person-centred care for seniors across Canada. This role includes:


 Fostering relationships with residents and families to ensure plan of care is resident focused and carried out;

 Managing, evaluating, and facilitating residents’ plan of care through collaboration with the resident, family members and the interdisciplinary team;

 Participate in residents’ care conferences;

 Collaborating with the Director of Care in facilitating resident move-in and transfers;

 Ensure safe medication administration according to regulatory requirements and Revera’s policies and procedures, including delegating medical administration to Unregulated Care Providers such as Personal Support Workers or Health Care Aides;

 Complete Clinical Assessments that ensure appropriate resident care;

 Liaise with interdisciplinary team and external care providers to facilitate best plan of care for each resident;

 Lead and support Personal Support Workers and Health Care Aides in your home area to maximize resident care. What YOU bring

 Current registration as a Registered Nurse in applicable Province

 Education and experience in gerontology, rehabilitation, community/complex/long term care an asset

 Experience working with seniors and unregulated care providers

 Strong assessment, documentation, communication and critical thinking skills

 Strong written, oral and time-management skills, including demonstrated experience delegating tasks to Personal Support Workers / Health Care Aides

 Proficiency with Technology including: Electronic Health Records, Electronic Medication Administration Records, Online Applications

 Current Basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC) What we offer

 Support from your Regional and National teams

 State-of-the-art technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Exceptional work/life balance Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow. Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!

Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

description:
If you’re passionate about leading a team that is, committed to the Team Member Experience and driven by innovation and growth, then join us!


We are looking for a Casual RPN to join our Bearbrook Retirement Residence! This line is 12 hour shifts!


The Registered Practical Nurse is a critical role within our communities as it impacts the lives of residents through the strong leadership and motivation of Sienna team members.

As a Registered Practical Nurse your typical day will impact in the following ways:


 Maintaining accountability for the nursing and personal care of residents within the scope of training and licensure.

 Administering medications as prescribed in accordance with pharmacy policies & procedures and observes changes in condition and reports them to the Director of Wellness.

 Facilitating problem solving of resident / family concerns or complaints that arise and ensures complaints are communicated to the Director of Wellness / General Manager.

 Overseeing the Guest Attendants to ensure that care assignments are completed and that changes in residents’ needs are reported to the Director of Wellness.

 Monitoring team member compliance with the policy on monitoring resident well-being and ensures follow-up is completed as required.

 Performing other duties as assigned.




Must Haves




 Possess a current registration with the provincial licensed nursing college.

 Possess prior experience in gerontology / working with seniors in community or Retirement setting.

 Have comprehensive knowledge of medication administration practices through completion of an approved pharmacology course in accordance with professional standards.

 Be skilled in planning and supervising the work of other personnel.

 Current First Aid/CPR certification.

 All applicants must successfully pass the prescribed Vulnerable Sector Check.




Bonus Points For Having




 Smart serve and food handling certificate an asset.


Act upon your desire to help others and Join Sienna Senior Living as we continue to enhance the lives of those we serve.

For Ontario locations, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process.

industries: Marketing Services, Environmental Services, and Consumer Services
description:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.



About The Brand Team



We’re a tight-knit, highly cross-functional team working to build Elastic’s brand. Our scope includes brand strategy and activation, employer brand, design, and video. Together we work with partners from across the company to elevate our company, our product, our leaders, and our culture. We leverage data, customer insights, and creative touchpoints so that internal and external stakeholders know, understand, and share the Elastic story.



About The Role



As our Senior Manager, Employer Brand, you’ll work collaboratively with leaders in Recruiting, DEI, Workplace, Brand, and Communications to establish Elastic as a virtual-first employer of choice. This role will own external campaigns as well as internal storytelling. You’ll develop and implement strategies and programs that tell the story of what it is like to work at Elastic. You’ll own projects from ideation to launch and measure what’s working and what’s not. Our new Senior Manager, Employer Brand will report to the Sr. Director Brand Strategy with direct lines to our VP, Recruiting and SVP, Global HR.



Responsibilities




Build and lead employer brand strategy aligned to our EVP, corporate positioning, and talent strategies

Build a narrative that communicates our company’s business objectives, culture, and values to our employees, prospective employees, and the industry

Create content and build experiences that tells the story of why Elastic is a great place to work

Partner with external agencies/consultants, internal teams, and Elastic leaders to establish Elastic as a virtual-first employer of choice

Partner with our Workplace, Recruiting, and Communications teams to drive alignment and excitement for our Employer Brand internally

Identify metrics to track and measure the impact of Employer Brand efforts and optimize priorities, programs, and plans accordingly




Must-Have Qualifications



If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.


8+ years working in Employer Brand, Communications, Content, or Brand Marketing

Demonstrated success leading Employer Brand programs, publishing content, raising executive profiles, and measuring results

Passion for brand marketing, events, and content creation as well as curiosity about how to motivate candidates to apply

Adept in working cross-functionally to incorporate and act on feedback from internal partners and senior leaders

Strong written and verbal communication skills. Deep understanding of how voice and tone are essential to communications and brand perception

Proven ability to define objectives, strategies and tasks without waiting for top-down direction

An effective multi-tasker who navigates a fast-paced environment and changing priorities




Nice-to-Have Qualifications




Experience working in a virtual capacity or high-growth tech company

Experience managing internal teams, external agencies, and/or contractors

Experience in creative campaigns/events such as videos, influencer marketing, social media, and paid advertising




Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People



As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.


Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary 

Health coverage for you and your family in many locations

Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles

Generous number of vacation days each year

Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)

Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love

Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

description:
Cassels Brock & Blackwell LLP is a leading national law firm focused on serving the transaction, advocacy and advisory needs of Canada’s most dynamic business sectors. We have one of the largest business law practices in the country, serving multinational, national and mid-market clients from our offices in Toronto, Vancouver and Calgary.




We are currently recruiting for an Assistant Director of HR, Legal Assistants in our Human Resources Department, reporting to the Director of HR. The ideal individual will be an approachable, seasoned leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment and excels at building trusted relationships.




This role will have one direct report and two indirect reports and will be responsible for the strategic direction, leadership and support of the overall provision of legal assistant resources to meet the needs of the business, in partnership with the Director of Human Resources. This role will be based in Vancouver, with national responsibility.






The successful candidate will be responsible for, but not limited to:







Leading the development and implementation of the ongoing strategic direction and structure for legal assistant resources nationally (including assistant replacements and document production).

Leading the integration, engagement and partnership between HR and lawyers, practice groups, legal assistants and other stakeholders in the firm as it relates to legal assistant resources.

Working closely with the Director HR and Manager HR, Legal Assistants to continuously assess and evolve the legal assistant resource support model to ensure it continues to meet the changing needs of the business.

Providing support to Manager HR, Legal Assistants for escalation of issues related to legal assistants, engaging the Assistant Director, HR – Employee Relations, as appropriate.

Providing partnership and support to the Manager HR, Legal Assistants for the creation of learning and development plans related to legal assistant resources.

Providing partnership and support to the Manager HR, Legal Assistants in assessing processes, workflows and technology being used by legal assistant resources and working closely with other department leaders to ensure efficient and effective support and enhanced productivity.

Leading the engagement of the HR Manager, HR Supervisors and practice chairs for annual compensation recommendations and partnering with the Director HR to participate in decision-making.

Building strong working relationships with the HR team, lawyers, legal assistants and other key stakeholders throughout the firm. Actively seeking to understand the needs of each individual office culture and working to ensure that the resources, structure and solutions meet those needs while working within the goals of the firm overall.

Partnering with the Manager HR, Legal Assistants to conduct quarterly meetings with practice chairs and co-chairing quarterly legal assistant resource group meetings.

Overseeing the collection, analysis and reporting of monthly HR statistics as it relates to legal assistant resources for review by Director of HR and senior management.

Assisting the Director of HR in the development and management of budgets, timelines, and metrics related to legal assistant resources.

Participating in the orientation of first year associates to build relationships and reinforce the role of legal assistant resources and introduce the HR team members managing those resources.

Actively maintaining a peer network and market awareness of best practices, trends and changes in the legal industry as it applies to legal assistant resources.

Providing partnership and support to Director HR on various HR-related projects and needs nationally, with a focus on legal assistant resources, as required.










The successful candidate must have the following education, experience and/or demonstrated skills:









 





Minimum 10 years of progressively complex human resources leadership experience in a law firm with a focus on legal assistant resources and employee relations.

CHRP designation is an asset.

Strong practical knowledge of a broad scope of human resources disciplines.

Proven ability to gain trust and build credibility with a variety of stakeholders effectively.

Demonstrated experience as a successful contributor in an environment that is demanding and constantly changing.

Leadership skills that will inspire enthusiasm, provide vision, create positive morale and support direct reports in delivering results.

Client focused and results oriented.

Clear and effective communication skills through all methods and ability to facilitate meetings and discussions to result in a successful outcome.

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively manage conflict.

An approachable manner with the ability to relate to people at all levels of the firm while providing effective coaching, advisement, support and guidance.

Ability to act as a role model of professional conduct pursuing excellence in execution, seeking opportunities for continuous improvement and producing effective recommendations and solutions that support both the people and the business.

Ability to anticipate outcomes and to adjust approach and services accordingly.

Ability to manage ambiguity, risk, and changing direction of projects and strategies.

Ability to work independently while understanding the importance of engaging key stakeholders for awareness or guidance and/or escalating issues as appropriate.

Demonstrated ability to assess, analyze and take appropriate action in situations that require an urgent response.

Motivated toward continuous improvement.









Employment Type: Permanent, Full-time





Our Firm’s success is built on the unique skills, perspectives, experiences and values of each individual. We encourage a corporate culture that respects and celebrates the dignity, value and diversity of all.




We wish to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No telephone enquiries, unless required for accommodation purposes.

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our 
Health And Safety Manager. 




Job Description



Reporting to the Plant Manager, this person will be responsible for the successful operation of the night shift sanitation teams in our allergen free facilities.



Position Summary/Objective



The Health and Safety Manager is responsible for the development, execution and monitoring of the Health and Safety programs for all Riverside Natural Food locations while ensuring a strong and effective health and safety culture company wide.



Primary Responsibilities



Demonstrate and uphold Riverside Natural Foods' Core Values

 Take OWNERSHIP of Riverside's Health and Safety Program

 Ensures compliance with regulatory requirements as well as Riverside Natural Foods policies and procedures related to health and safety

 Lead the development and review of health and safety related policies and procedures (SOPs)

 Perform vital managerial functions:


 Monitor, train, cross train, coach, and mentor staff. Manage hiring, performance, discipline and termination of staff

 Demonstrating HUMILITY by displaying good leadership by helping the TEAM succeed 

Coordinate training and coaching of staff in processes and procedures related to H&S

 Manage H&S related communication across all departments

Manager the development, implementation, and maintenance of the Job Safety Analysis (JSA), Safe Work Procedures (SWP) and Physical Demand Analysis (PDA) for all Riverside positions

Facilitate and develop work processes for audits, accident investigations, incident investigations and site inspections of operational procedures, facility design, equipment and materials

Ensures appropriate risk assessments are conducted and implemented to minimize or eliminate accidents that might cause harm to employees, contractors, visitors, assets or reputation 

Identify and evaluate hazardous conditions and practices in the workplace

Ensure effective Joint Health and Safety Committee (JHSC) meetings, investigation of issues raised, and implementation of associated corrective actions are in place at each facility

Design and deliver training programs for employees, management and the JHSC members to comply with and exceed legislative requirements

Take OWNERSHIP in the investigation and resolution of incidents

Develop and monitor performance and key metrics in health and safety and facilitate implementation of corrective and preventative actions where required 

Lead for workplace injury management to include Ministry of Labor (MOL) reporting, training and injury reduction

Act as the main point of contact for any MOL or related visits and investigations

Remain current on new legislation, codes, technologies and development in the H&S field

Contribute positively in creating a safe and secure environment

 Perform vital managerial functions:


 Monitor, train, cross train, coach, and mentor staff. Manage hiring, performance, discipline and termination of staff

 Demonstrating HUMILITY by displaying good leadership by helping the TEAM succeed 

Coordinate training and coaching of staff in processes and procedures related to H&S

 Manage H&S related communication across all departments

Contribute positively in creating a safe and secure environment

Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming

 Other duties as required 




Reporting Relationship



The position reports directly to the Director of Manufacturing. The H&S Coordinators and the Occupational Health Nurse reports to this position.



Education & Qualifications




Post-Secondary education in a related field and a minimum of 5 years of related working experience in manufacturing

 In depth knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), WHMIS, ISO Standards and all other workplace Health and Safety regulations

 Familiar with WSIB reporting and return to work programs

 Possess or be in the process of obtaining the Certified Registered Safety Professional (CRSP) 

Previous experience working with regulatory bodies such as the Ministry of Labor




Skills & Abilities




Ability to be persuasive, assertive while also being collaborative with diverse teams

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills with follow through abilities

 Analytical, with problem-identification and problem-solving capabilities

 Strong TEAM player demonstrated ability to work collaboratively to achieve common goals

 PASSIONATE with a positive attitude with a desire to learn and collaborate

 Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY

 Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis 

Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside's Core Values in a changing environment




How To Apply



If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line 
Health And Safety Manager
 or click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Depending on the nature of the role, you may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by your hire date to be eligible to start the role. In this case, proof of vaccination will be required by your start date. Riverside will consider and review accommodation requests based on protected human rights grounds for qualified candidates.

industries: Wellness and Fitness Services and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
If you’re passionate about leading a team that is, committed to the Team Member Experience and driven by innovation and growth, then join us!

The Office Manager is a critical role within our communities as it impacts the lives of residents and ignites the warmth of human connection.

As an Office Manager your typical day will impact in the following ways:


 Managing and monitoring all administration expenses, assists in the explanation of monthly variances and works with the Executive Director/General Manager to identify corrective action.

 Maintaining petty cash system with accurate recording of cash distributed and receipts/signed vouchers for each transaction.

 Entering and updating all accommodation rates and miscellaneous monthly billing charges as applicable.

 Receiving invoices and packing slips and ensuring they are matched with invoices and checked and coded by department heads.

 Reconciling Trust account monthly and forwarding to head office.

 Managing concierge/reception team members and assigns duties, if applicable.

 Performing other duties as assigned.




Must Haves




 Must have successfully completed a bookkeeping certificate or accounting courses at a Community College, and possess proven office administration skills.

 Must possess excellent leadership and communication skills.

 Must have experience in working as part of an interdisciplinary team.

 Must be proficient with WORD, Excel, e-mail, internet use and computerized documentation.

 All applicants must successfully pass the prescribed Vulnerable Sector Check. Applicable to Ontario applicants.

 All applicants must successfully pass the prescribed Criminal Records Check. Applicable to British Columbia applicants.


Act upon your desire to help others and Join Sienna Senior Living as we continue to enhance the lives of those we serve.

Sienna Senior Living is committed to employment equity, diversity, and inclusion in the workplace. In accordance with provincial regulations, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection, and assessment process.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality
description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


YOU make a difference

If you want to feel like you are making a difference every day, you've come to the right place. Our residents are unique and special, and so are our employees. By working in our homes, you can help create memorable experiences for our seniors.

Revera’s person-centred approach offers security and peace of mind to both residents and family members. We believe we work in our residents’ homes, and care passionately about providing excellent care, with state-of-the art facilities and vibrant, welcoming communities. For many of us, providing care is more than a career — it’s a calling.

The Opportunity

Ready to make a difference in the lives of seniors? We’re looking for an experienced Registered Practical Nurse to join our team of dedicated health professionals. Reporting to the Director of Care, you will play a key role in our patient-centred, goal-directed approach to care. From evaluating clinical care plans to administering medication and other treatment, your role is as important as it is fulfilling.



A Typical Day Might Include




 Fostering relationships with residents and families to ensure plan of care is resident focused and carried out;

 Evaluating a resident’s plan of care, ensuring the assessment is up to date and accurately documented;

 Processing and administering medication in accordance with regulatory requirements;

 Collaborating with and advising Personal Support Workers and staff on best practices related to the delivery of our health-care programs and policies;

 Supporting the arrival, transfer or departure of residents;

 Responding to emerging health conditions and medical emergencies, including the delivery of first-aid care.


What YOU bring


 Current registration as a Registered Practical Nurse in your province of work

 Experience working with seniors and alongside Personal Support Workers, as well as education tied to gerontology, rehabilitation and long term care

 Current basic Cardiac Life Support and First Aid certification

 Proficient assessment, documentation and communication skills

 Proficiency with technology including: Electronic Health Records, Electronic Medication Administration Records, Online Applications

 Current (within 6 months) Vulnerable Position/Sector Check (VSC)


What we offer


 Technology to help you do your job better

 Benefits and Pension Package

 Excellent work/life balance

 Vision to support Person-Centered Care


Ask yourself if what you're doing today is getting you closer to where you want to be tomorrow.

Join us in celebrating the ageless spirit of people. Apply today!

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Construction, and Oil and Gas
description:
48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.




We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?



Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com




Responsibilities



This role covers all aspects of leading a team through conceptual and feasibility studies and into FEED stages of multiple projects. These include:


Lead the engineering for multidiscipline materials handling projects from conceptual studies to detailed design, and through construction to start up, for ports, terminals and mines

Prepare technical specifications and reports for bulk handling systems and equipment including bulk conveying systems and transfers, bulk loading and unloading equipment including feeders and bins, crushing plants and related facilities

Develop estimates and manpower forecasts

Track and report work progress

Develop work plans and budgets

Prepare detailed analysis and design

Mentor junior engineers and prepare training plans

Be available for short term assignments worldwide

Establish and grow internal and external client relations




Qualifications




What you bring:



A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering

Registered or eligible for registration with EGBC

Minimum 10 years of experience in design of bulk materials handling systems and equipment

Detailed materials handling calculations

Experience with high capacity materials handling equipment is an asset

Excellent technical writing and presentation skills

Strong written and verbal communication skills 

Excellent organizational and time management skills




What We Offer You




Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.



Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.




If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.
